column2: Greetings from Future Focus Infotech!!!   This is Ria from FFI-Mumbai; we have an opportunity for Windows Administrator with our Client   Experience: 2+ yrs   Skill: Working As Windows Administrator L1   Windows   Skills:  Maintain Datacenter and monitor Fire Panel, VESDA and UPS.  Mount and unmounts Server and provided connectivity of UPS and Essential power.  Maintain server and Monitor the server using OMSA Application and check the Health Status of server is working proper or not.  In OMSA Application check firmware update, Processor, VDisk, Physical disk, Connectors, Fans, etc. If we get any issues we can replace it or else call log to vendor Team.  Do the troubleshooting on server like replace SMPS, swipe CPU / Processor, Change CMOS battery, check electric power.  Install windows server OS in new server and configure ILO, configure RAID, NIC Teaming and monitor server through whatsapp GOLD and Wiking application.  Configure ADDS, DNS and DHCP. Create a scope and do Mac filtering and IP reservation as per permission.  Create ADC server of DC as per permission and requirement. Create User ID and password and put in domain.  Updates patches in server as per schedules using Bigfix application.  Create and Monitor VM machines and Install ESXI in the server and configure IP address, DNS.  Using Webclient Vsphere create Vm machines and add share storage and also add NFS files.  Install Vcenter and add host in it and provide share storage using ISCSI, NFS files, Provide RDM to Vm machines. Monitor CPU utilization and Storage.  Do migration activity using Vmotion and check DRS, HA as per schedules.  Take a snapshort and create clone and template.  Create port group and Maintain user as per department.  Create Roles and permission and Join Domain.  Have some knowledge in Storage and GPO policy  Managing Infrastructure Servers both Virtual and Physical Globally.  Creation of User Accounts on AD (Active Directory / User Manager).  Creation of home folders for the users locating the correct Server, grant Home folder permission.  Granting access to the Servers/  Share   Folders & Files on both the domains.  Adding Desktop Machines/Laptops to the Active Directory.  Creation\Deletion\Moving of AD accounts with in the domain.  Microsoft Windows security patches management & deployment.  Also performing the Hardware checks through  Solarwinds  and  ILO   Console.  Configuring and troubleshooting Group policies for controlling computers and users.  Installing, configuring and troubleshooting of DHCP in win 2008.  Knowledge in Windows Terminal Service.  Providing  On   Call   support  for priority incidents.   Notice period: Immediate    Job location: Mumbai (Andheri)  CTC to be offered: up to 34000   Only interested candidates apply for the opening. Fresher do not apply. column2: What are we looking for:         Hands-on experience in deploying and managing Kubernetes clusters in airgap environments, preferably within financial institutions or similarly regulated industries, is required.      Familiarity with a cloud-native CI/CD tool used for Kubernetes deployments is necessary.     Knowledge of GKE (Google Cloud Platform) and RKE (Rancher Kubernetes Engine) is preferred.     Knowledge of Rook-Ceph distributed storage is preferred.     You should be able to manage multi-region clusters for disaster recovery.     You should have experience working with programmable infrastructure, such as building a CI/CD pipeline.     Familiarity with monitoring and observability tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, and the ELK stack is expected.     You should possess good knowledge of Linux operating systems and be proficient in troubleshooting OS issues.     It is essential not to use terms like high availability or resilient systems without a thorough understanding of their basics, as building such systems in practice requires significant effort.     Knowledge of security and compliance frameworks and best practices relevant to financial institutions is necessary.     Preferred certifications include CKA (Certified Kubernetes Administrator) and CKAD (Certified Kubernetes Application Developer).         What you will be learning and doing         You will be working with customers trying to transform their applications and adopt cloud-native technologies. The technologies used will be Kubernetes, Prometheus, Service Mesh, and public cloud technologies or on-premise infrastructure.     The problems and solutions are continuously evolving in space but fundamentally you will be solving problems with the simplest and most scalable automation.     You will be hacking around open source projects, understand their capabilities, and limitations, and apply the right tool for the right job.     You will be educating the customers - from their operations engineers to developers on scalable ways to build and operate applications in modern cloud-native infrastructure
column11: Automation, Linux, Operating systems, Finance, Disaster recovery, Cloud, Infrastructure, Troubleshooting, Open source, Monitoring

column2: Onit, India is looking for a Senior Infrastructure Engineer to join our team in Pune and provide engineering support for diverse infrastructure across numerous geographical locations.              As a Sr. Infrastructure              Engineer,              you will be immersed in all aspects of provisioning,     managing, and securing infrastructure at Onit. You will have a wide variety of problems to solve, from supporting and building AWS infrastructure, automating infrastructure provisioning, and improving the security, scalability, and reliability of our applications running in the cloud.                              The position is part of the Core Infrastructure team at Onit and will work across the Onit organization to provide secure and reliable infrastructure.                                           Responsibilities:                                 Build and maintain infrastructure as code to provision infrastructure using several tools: Terraform, Ansible, CloudFormation, Jenkins, Helm.                             Build and support network (VPC/ VPN), encryption, certificates, and other AWS core infrastructure for Onit.                              Troubleshoot infrastructure issues and collaborate with support specialists and Cloud Operations / SRE.                             Help define and leverage best practices for security, compliance, and governance across Onit applications infrastructure.                             Help evaluate emerging Cloud and DevOps technologies continually to identify opportunities, trends, and best practices to strengthen development practices.                             Collaborate with and mentor team members within the Core Infrastructure team in US and India.                             Create automation, runbooks, and playbooks to help others support the infrastructure.                                    Required Skills:                               6+ years recent experience managing and automating infrastructure in AWS using Infrastructure as Code (CloudFormation, Terraform, etc.)                             Strong understanding and experience with AWS networking (VPC, VPN), encryption, certificates                             Strong understanding and experience with AWS security (IAM, SSO, Security Groups, KMS, CloudHSM, etc..), encryption at rest, encryption in transit.                              Strong understand of EC2 and advanced Linux skills to help update, support, and troubleshoot Linux OS issues.                              Experience with s             ecurity tooling implementation and management. Elastic SIEM, Crowdstrike, Guard Duty, or similar                             Strong understanding of AWS SysOps (System Manager, Patching, AWS Backups, WAF, sftp, etc.)                             Experience securing containerized workloads in the cloud (AWS EKS a plus)                             Strong understanding of AWS KMS. CloudHSM experience is a plus.                                              Desired Skills               :                             Experience in the following: AWS (RDS, EFS, EKS, ECS, Elastic cache, VPC), Datadog, Antivirus software, SIEM and CSPM related security software.                             Postgres or any SQL database experience.                             Experience with Cloudflare (WAF / Security, DNS, Zero Trust) is a plus.                             Experience using Ansible is a plus.                             Experience with Enterprise Web applications in production.                             Experience with a programming language such as Python a plus.                             AWS certifications in Security, Networking, and Sysops a plus.                             Experience using and managing Git (GitLab a plus), CI/CD pipelines (eg: Jenkins, GitLab CI)

column2: Job Summary The Cloud Support Engineer performs a variety of tasks related to designing, planning, managing, maintaining, and supporting cloud-based applications and infrastructure.  Supporting multiple cloud providers, AWS and Azure, and other technical platforms like M365 and Databricks. This position will be in Global Corporate Services - IT (GCS IT) department. Primary Duties & Responsibilities Design and Planning : Design and plan cloud infrastructure and solutions. This includes understanding the customer's needs and requirements, and designing a cloud solution that meets those needs. Implementation and Deployment : Implement and deploy the designed cloud solution. This includes setting up the cloud infrastructure and configuring cloud services. System Management and Maintenance : Holistically manage and maintain the cloud infrastructure and applications. This includes monitoring system performance, troubleshooting issues, and ensuring that the cloud services are running smoothly and efficiently. Security Management : Holistically manage the security of the cloud infrastructure and applications. This includes implementing security measures, monitoring threats, and responding to security incidents. Backup and Recovery : Holistically manage data backup and recovery processes. Performance Optimization : Optimize the performance of the cloud infrastructure and applications. This includes optimizing resource usage, improving system performance, and ensuring that the cloud services are delivering optimal performance. Cost Management : Holistically manage the cost of the cloud services. This includes monitoring and controlling the cost of cloud services and optimizing the use of resources to reduce costs. Compliance and Governance : Ensure that the cloud infrastructure and applications comply with relevant laws, regulations, and organizational policies. Collaboration and Communication : Work closely with other IT professionals, such as network engineers, system administrators, and software developers, to ensure that the cloud services are integrated and aligned with the organization's IT strategy. Required Skills & Qualification The ideal candidate must have a minimum of 5 years of experience working in a similar capacity (cloud engineering).  The ideal candidate must have a minimum of 3 years of experience with AWS and Azure; must have certifications with those cloud providers. The ideal candidate must have minimum 3 years of hands-on system management. The ideal candidate must be hands on with Python, bash and PowerShell.  Must have excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.  Preferred Skills & Qualification   HITRUST experience.  GCP experience. Experience with M365 Experience with Databricks. Infrastructure as Code (IaC) experience, especially with Terraform.   Kubernetes and Containers-as-a-Service (CaaS) experience.   AI/ML experience.
column11: Bash Scripting, Powershell, Python, Aws Certified, Azure Certified, Cloud Infrastructure, Data Bricks

column2: As an Infrastructure Engineer, you will bring a solid foundation in Azure cloud services and a familiarity with Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) environments. Your primary focus will be on maintaining the robustness, efficiency, and scalability of our digital infrastructure. This role requires a good understanding of cloud technologies, IIoT applications, and proficiency in automation.     Your duties will encompass the deployment and management of our Azure infrastructure, ensuring seamless integration with Aveva PI systems and other IoT platforms. You will apply your knowledge of PowerShell, Terraform, and other automation tools to improve system performance and dependability.       What you will Be Doing:           Application Administrative Tasks:         Perform daily administration tasks on Windows, Aveva PI, and Digital Twin solutions to support our customers.         Ensure optimal performance and reliability of Aveva PI systems.             1st Line Support Tasks / Day-to-Day Triage:         Manage incoming incidents and service requests, providing first-line support and troubleshooting.         Prioritize and triage issues effectively to ensure timely resolution.             Operational Focus:         Develop and maintain strong relationships with implementation teams to facilitate smooth project execution.         Adhere to change management protocols to ensure system integrity during updates and modifications.         Proactively identify inefficiencies in platforms and applications, suggesting improvements.             SOP Building:         Create and update Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) to streamline processes and ensure consistent service delivery.         Enhancing Automation Skills and Embracing DevOps and SRE Culture:             Continuously improve your automation skills, aligning with DevOps and Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) practices.         Provide open feedback on system performance and user experience, contributing to a culture of continuous improvement.         Identify bottlenecks and constraints in systems, collaborating with 2nd and 3rd line teams to implement solutions.         Champion initiatives for continuous improvement, focusing on efficiency and effectiveness in operations.                 This role requires a proactive approach to system management, a commitment to continuous learning and improvement, and a collaborative attitude towards working with various teams within the organization.           Why should you join us?               Be at the forefront of transforming Weirs technological landscape.         Shape the future of IIoT architecture in a dynamic and collaborative environment.         Work with a diverse and inclusive team where your ideas matter.         Competitive compensation and benefits package.           Job Knowledge/Education and Qualifications:            Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.              Azure Certification               Experience           General understanding of cloud services including Azure Cloud, AWS, or GCP.         At least 5 years of experience in IT systems, with some exposure to Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) technologies.         Aveva PI Knowledge significant advantage         Basic knowledge of IIoT architectures and platforms, including familiarity with concepts like MQTT, Edge computing, and cloud-based systems.         Experience in managing IT projects and collaborating with technical teams to deliver solutions effectively.         Familiarity with standard IT practices in networking, system security, and cloud service management.         Comfortable using basic IT management tools and some knowledge of automation tools (e.g., Terraform, Ansible).         Basic skills in scripting or programming languages such as Python, PowerShell, or Bash for routine tasks and configuration.         Good problem-solving abilities, capable of addressing common IT system issues and finding practical solutions.         Strong communication skills, able to work well with cross-functional teams and articulate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.         Organized, detail-oriented, and capable of handling multiple tasks in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.         Communication Skills: This role requires effective communication skills for working within a diverse and complex organization. The ability to engage with team members and stakeholders at various levels, aligning IT projects with broader organizational goals, is essential.               Technical Skills:        A keen interest in technology trends is beneficial. The candidate should have a good grasp of basic IT system tools and practices, including some familiarity with automation tools like Terraform and scripting with PowerShell or Python. A general understanding of cloud platforms, particularly Azure, is desirable.

column2: Project Role : Cloud Platform Engineer Project Role Description : Designs, builds, tests, and deploys cloud application solutions that integrate cloud and non-cloud infrastructure. Can deploy infrastructure and platform environments, creates a proof of architecture to test architecture viability, security and performance.  Must have skills : Cloud Automation DevOps, CCNP-RS, PMP, Prince2, ITIL V3 Good to have skills : NA Minimum  3  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : 15 years of full time education Summary :As a Cloud Platform Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building, testing, and deploying cloud application solutions that integrate cloud and non-cloud infrastructure. Your typical day will involve deploying infrastructure and platform environments, creating a proof of architecture to test architecture viability, security, and performance using Cloud Automation DevOps skills.  Roles & Responsibilities: Design, build, test, and deploy cloud application solutions that integrate cloud and non-cloud infrastructure using Cloud Automation DevOps skills. Deploy infrastructure and platform environments, create a proof of architecture to test architecture viability, security, and performance. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure successful delivery of cloud application solutions. Provide technical guidance and support to team members and stakeholders. Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Cloud Automation DevOps. Strong understanding of cloud infrastructure and platform environments. Experience with cloud automation tools such as Ansible, Chef, or Puppet. Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes. Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 3 years of experience in Cloud Automation DevOps. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful cloud-based solutions. This position is based at our Hyderabad office. Qualification 15 years of full time education

column2: Job Title: Cloud Engineer Experience Level: 4 to 8 Years Location: Hyderabad Notice Period: Immediate / 15 days Mode of Work: Hybrid Job Type: Contract to Hire   Job Description:  We are looking for a talented Cloud Engineer to join our team in Hyderabad. The ideal candidate will have 5 to 8 years of experience in cloud engineering and support, with a strong focus on AWS services. This is an excellent opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies in a dynamic and collaborative environment. Responsibilities: Design, deploy, and maintain enterprise-level cloud solutions on AWS platform. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement scalable and reliable cloud architectures. Utilize infrastructure as code (IaC) principles for network setup, monitoring, and other infrastructure components. Administer Linux and Windows systems and automate tasks using tools like Ansible, Puppet, or Chef. Develop test-driven code in Python, Typescript, and ReactJS, utilizing version control systems like Git. Implement and maintain cloud orchestration using technologies such as CloudFormation or Terraform. Work in Agile Scrum or Kanban environments, ensuring timely delivery of projects and support tasks. Uphold operational security best practices and ensure compliance with industry standards. Requirements: Minimum of 10 years of overall experience in the IT industry. 5 - 8 years of experience specifically in cloud engineering and support. Proficiency in AWS services and deployment at scale; AWS certification is highly appreciated. Strong understanding of cloud architecture, networking, and microservices architecture. Experience with Linux and Windows system administration. Knowledge of OS automation tools such as Ansible, Puppet, Chef, or Saltstack. Expertise in test-driven coding using Python, Typescript, and ReactJS. Mastery of at least one cloud orchestration technology (CloudFormation, Terraform). Familiarity with application orchestration and packaging tools like GitHub Actions. Experience working in Agile Scrum or Kanban projects. Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and as part of a team. Desirable Skills: Masters degree in computer science, engineering, or related field. Experience with incident and change management processes. Ability to act as a mentor and escalation point for junior employees. Strong analytical skills and problem-solving abilities. Excellent communication skills and ability to effectively interact with stakeholders. Willingness to stay updated with emerging technologies and industry trends. Availability for standby duties if required.

Work closely with the architecture team to ensure alignment with best practices and organizational standards.           Platform Migration:       Lead the migration of payment processing systems to cloud environments, ensuring minimal downtime and optimal performance.     Collaborate with development and operations teams to develop migration strategies and execution plans.           Automation and Orchestration:       Develop and implement automation scripts and orchestration workflows to streamline deployment, scaling, and maintenance processes.     Leverage Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools to manage and version infrastructure configurations.           Security and Compliance:       Implement security best practices for cloud environments, including identity and access management, encryption, and network security,    with a strong focus on adhering to PCI-DSS standards.       Ensure compliance with industry regulations and internal security policies.           Monitoring and Performance Optimization:       Establish monitoring and alerting systems for payment processing applications on the cloud.     Continuously optimize performance, troubleshoot issues, and implement improvements to enhance system reliability.           Collaboration and Communication:       Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, architects, and operations, to understand requirements and deliver effective solutions.     Provide technical guidance and expertise to team members and stakeholders.             Qualifications:         Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.     Proven experience as a Cloud Engineer or similar role, with a focus on payment processing systems.     In-depth knowledge of Azure cloud platform     Strong understanding of containerization and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).     Proficient in scripting languages such as Python, Bash, or PowerShell.     Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform or CloudFormation.     Solid understanding of security best practices and compliance requirements.     Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot complex issues.     Effective communication and collaboration skills.     Possess knowledge of PCI-DSS requirements and guidelines to apply them effectively in the cloud-based payment processing systems.     Relevant certifications ( Azure Solutions Architect) are a plus.

column2: Designing Cloud Infrastructure: Develop and implement cloud-based solutions based on business requirements, selecting appropriate cloud services and components to meet performance, scalability, and reliability goals.     Cloud Deployment: Deploy, configure, and manage cloud services such as virtual machines, containers, databases, storage, networking, and security services across multiple cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).     Automation: Develop automation scripts and tools to streamline cloud infrastructure provisioning, configuration management, and deployment processes, using tools such as Terraform, Ansible, or cloud provider-specific tools.     Monitoring and Optimization: Monitor cloud infrastructure performance, availability, and costs, and implement optimization strategies to improve efficiency, reduce costs, and enhance performance.     Security and Compliance: Implement security best practices and compliance standards to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data and applications in the cloud environment, including identity and access management, encryption, and network security.     Troubleshooting and Support: Troubleshoot issues related to cloud infrastructure and services, provide technical support, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to resolve incidents and ensure system reliability.     Documentation and Training: Document cloud architecture, configurations, and procedures, and provide training and guidance to other team members on cloud technologies and best practices.     Continuous Learning: Stay updated on emerging cloud technologies, industry trends, and best practices, and actively participate in professional development activities such as training, certifications, and community engagement.
column11: Automation, Networking, Access management, Cloud Services, Configuration management, Cloud, Network security, Security services, Infrastructure, Technical support

Configure and maintain cloud infrastructure, including virtual machines, storage systems, and network settings. column2: APPS Associates Pvt.Ltd is looking for Cloud Engineer to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.        A Cloud Engineer is responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining an organization's cloud computing infrastructure.          The following are some key responsibilities for a Cloud Engineer:         Design and implement cloud computing solutions using technologies such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, or Google Cloud Platform (GCP).     Configure and maintain cloud infrastructure, including virtual machines, storage systems, and network settings.     Monitor and optimize cloud performance, including resources utilization and cost management.     Implement and maintain security and compliance measures to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data and systems.     Troubleshoot and resolve cloud infrastructure issues, and perform root cause analysis to prevent future incidents.     Stay up-to-date with the latest cloud computing technologies, trends, and best practices.         Requirements:         Strong knowledge of cloud computing technologies, such as virtualization, containers, and automation.     Experience with scripting languages such as Python, Bash, or PowerShell.     Good understanding of network protocols, security best practices, and compliance standards.     Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

column2: Who We Are Elixr Labs is where technology meets healthcare. We Elixr Labs as Offshore Development Partner of Mobileheartbeat (Hospital Corporation of Americas fully owned subsidiary)? We thrive by creating solutions to primarily improve the efficiency of healthcare professionals and installations. Our mobility solutions give a blanket coverage over all functions in the healthcare vertical from research to surgery. Our team consists of engineers who are experienced in this niche vertical that requires unique set of skills that cater to creating solutions for the healthcare vertical.? What You'll Do Write/Debug and manage code for infrastructure using tools like Terraform. Collaborate with team members and ensure timely completion of tasks. Manage DevOps delivery processes. Plan and oversee team budget. Conduct team building and identify training needs of the team. Identify business opportunities for team expansion and recruitment. The skills and qualifications you'll need- Qualifications: Bachelors Degree (Computer Science) 10+ years of experience in the IT field with at least 5 years dedicated to DevOps  2+ years of management experience. Infrastructure as Code (IaC): Proficient knowledge of Infrastructure as Code (IaC). CI/CD Tooling: Proficiency with continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) tooling and practices. CI/CD Implementation: Design and maintain robust CI/CD pipelines. Automation Expertise: Expertise in automation and shift left practices to implement and maintain Infra using orchestration tools such as Terraform, Python and shell scripting for system administration and automation. Cloud Services: Hands-on experience with cloud services, including AWS, Azure, and GCP, to architect, deploy, and manage infrastructure and services. GitHub Repository Management: Experience in managing both micro and macro GitHub repositories, Git administration and branching methodology.? System Administration: Good to have skill in System administration ( both Linux and Windows environments), including hands-on experience with Linux systems and kernel upgrades.  Cross-functional Knowledge: Good to have Cross-functional knowledge with systems, storage, networking, security, and databases.  Management: Manage the DevOps delivery, participate in team budgeting, team management, and identify new business opportunities. Behavioural Skills (Role specific) 	Effective Communication: Communicates clearly with team members and stakeholders, especially in remote settings. Effectively escalates blockers during daily Stand-Ups. Excellent interpersonal, listening, written, and verbal skills.  Proactive: Being proactive and resourceful in addressing challenges is essential. This includes identifying issues early, proposing solutions, and seeking help or guidance when needed.  Problem Solving: Strong analytical and problem solving skills for independent troubleshooting and debugging. Experience using Agile/Scrum development methodologies, will contribute regularly and actively in ceremonies. Time Management: Ability to multi-task and has organizational skills to manage assigned tasks to meet deadlines, and manage multiple tasks simultaneously. Result Orientation: Demonstrates & educates the ability to focus, enable and drive teams persistently to achieve assigned targets. Adaptability: Adapt to changing priorities, requirements, and technologies. Attention to Detail: Meticulous attention to detail to ensure quality in code development and improvement.  Collaboration: Strong teamwork and collaboration skills to work efficiently across teams and across the required time zones, to contribute to sprint planning and user stories. Continuous Learning: Commits to staying up to date with DevOps trends and best practices. Competitive Compensation and Benefits Elixr offers competitive salaries and benefits and an environment that encourages employees to achieve their career goals. What we offer at Elixr? At Elixr, you will enjoy a robust rewards package which includes: Opportunity to work on various projects of various sizes. Competitive salary. Group Insurance. Learning and development programs, training, career opportunities. About The Team Our team is collaborative, positive, curious, and engaged. We think fast, work smart and are looking for like-minded people to join our team. Elixr is strongly committed to diversity within its community. As an Equal Opportunities employer, we welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. Follow Us For more information about our company follow us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, and Instagram. You can also follow our careers-focused channels on LinkedIn to keep up with our latest job postings.

column2: If you re a motivated team player looking for an opportunity to work with many different systems and technologies, this may be the fit for you     Our ideal candidate will be a problem solver and a collaborator with good communication skills and the ability to work with teams from different organizations, geographies, and cultures within a fast-paced growing company     To support projected growth we must take advantage of the features and functionality native to cloud-based services and technologies     Our next Cloud Infrastructure Engineer will be a key part of our Cloud Infrastructure team working to automate and modernize our systems and processes     We will take advantage of leading-edge technologies and solutions to drive the scalability of our organization               As part of the larger infrastructure team, you will:           Demonstrate ability to design, implement, and administer cloud-based solutions taking advantage of native technologies and services.     Work in a primarily Microsoft web application environment spanning multiple cloud platforms. Including Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud Platform     Automate technology deployment through use of cloud automation tools.     Be responsible for managing, maintaining, and securing the Supplier.io infrastructure.     Install and maintain cloud servers, databases, and services according to best practice.     Manage cloud-based network and security systems.     Support cloud servers and databases including security configurations, patching, and troubleshooting.     Monitor, tune, and report on servers, databases and other devices/systems to ensure optimal performance and capacity.         Tracking and resolution of database related incidents and requests     Recommend proactive measures to ensure minimal downtime within area of responsibility.     Recommend cost optimizations within area of responsibility.     Collaborate with the larger team to design and implement strategic solutions to recurring problems.     Develop and maintain the data protection, backup schedules and recovery plans for systems within area of responsibility.     Create and maintain technical documentation including runbooks, environment and application diagrams, data flow maps, security, etc.     Be responsible for project scope, objectives, and timelines.     Provide escalation support and mentor other staff members.     Work in an on-call capacity as part of the infrastructure team     Perform other duties as assigned.           The ideal candidate will have many of the listed skills and a desire to grow in other areas:           Expert proficiency with Microsoft Windows Server, RedHat / CentOS, and Ubuntu in cloud-based environments     Advanced knowledge of cloud automation tools such as Terraform, CloudFormation, Azure Resource Manager, etc.     Experience with CI/CD solutions including Azure DevOps and AWS CodeCommit / CodePipeline     Ability to research and plan taking a concept from idea to production     Experience supporting web application and database servers     Previous backup and disaster recovery experience     Experience with scripting languages (PowerShell, Bash, AWS/Azure/GCP, etc.)     Experience configuring and managing cloud-based firewalls, load balancers, switches, routers, servers, and security devices     Network and systems monitoring / capacity planning experience     Ability to troubleshoot complex technical issues         Knowledge and experience with MS SQL Server, MySQL, PostgreSQL, and/or MongoDB     Previous experience managing hosted database solutions such as Aurora, RDS, PostgreSQL, etc.     Excellent organizational and analytical skills     Technical knowledge and aptitude in the areas of networks, network topologies, application servers, applicable software and troubleshooting techniques               Nice to Have           Knowledge of AWS / Azure / GCP APIs     Apache and PHP knowledge     Microsoft IIS (v6 and later) experience     Experience with IPS/IDS, WAF, and/or SIEM     Experience with Web Application monitoring     Knowledge of Active Directory and Group Policy

column2: A career in our Cybersecurity, Privacy and Forensics will provide you the opportunity to solve our clients most critical business and data protection related challenges      You will be part of a growing team driving strategic programs, data analytics, innovation, deals, cyber resilency, response, and technical implementation activities      You will have access to not only the top Cybersecurity, Privacy and Forensics professionals at PwC, but at our clients and industry analysts across the globe      The Enterprise and Cloud Security (ECS) team is a specialized group of cybersecurity professionals responsible for securing an organizations cloud-based infrastructure and applications      This team works closely with the clients to identify, assess, design, architect and mitigate potential security risks associated with cloud-based technologies, such as Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), and Software as a Service (SaaS)      They have in-depth knowledge of cloud platforms, such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), and others, as well as a deep understanding of industry leading cybersecurity practices, standards, and compliance requirements                        As a Senior Associate, youll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:            Use feedback and reflection to develop self awareness, personal strengths and address development areas.      Delegate to others to provide stretch opportunities, coaching them to deliver results.      Demonstrate critical thinking and the ability to bring order to unstructured problems.      Use a broad range of tools and techniques to extract insights from current industry or sector trends.      Review your work and that of others for quality, accuracy and relevance.      Know how and when to use tools available for a given situation and can explain the reasons for this choice.      Seek and embrace opportunities which give exposure to different situations, environments and perspectives.      Use straightforward communication, in a structured way, when influencing and connecting with others.      Able to read situations and modify behavior to build quality relationships.      Uphold the firms code of ethics and business conduct.              Job Description          Sr Associate - Cloud Security, Microsoft Azure and M365              Core Requirements        We re looking for an experienced Azure and M365 specialist with background in the following areas:            Proven experience with two or more of the following areas:          Threat Detection and Monitoring        :    Configure and deploy Defender for Cloud (MDC) for threat detection, vulnerability assessment, and security monitoring, utilizing advanced features such as Microsoft Sentinel for security incident response and automation.          Identity and Access Management (IAM)      : Configure and manage identity and access controls using Entra ID, including user authentication, authorization policies, multi-factor authentication (MFA), and conditional access.          Data Governance and Compliance      : Implement data governance policies and compliance frameworks using Azure Policy, Azure Blueprint, and Azure Compliance Manager to enforce regulatory requirements and industry standards.          Data Protection and Encryption      : Implement data protection measures, encryption, and key management solutions using Azure Key Vault, Azure Information Protection (AIP), and Azure Disk Encryption to safeguard sensitive data and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.          Microsoft 365 Configuration and Optimization      : Configure and optimize Microsoft 365 services such as Exchange Online, SharePoint Online, and Microsoft Teams for collaboration, communication, and productivity, ensuring seamless integration with Azure services and adherence to security best practices.        Cloud Architecture Design and Implementation    : Design and implement scalable, reliable, and secure cloud architecture solutions on the Microsoft Azure platform, leveraging services such as Azure Virtual Machines, Azure App Service, Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), and Azure SQL Database.        Network Security    : Design and configure secure network architectures on Azure, including Secure Landing Zone, Virtual Networks (VNets), Network Security Groups (NSGs), Azure Firewall, and Azure DDoS Protection, to protect against network-based threats and ensure data confidentiality and integrity.        Incident Response and Forensics    : Develop incident response procedures and perform forensic analysis of security incidents using Azure Security Center, Azure Monitor, and Microsoft 365 Security & Compliance Center to identify root causes and mitigate future risks.                  Familiarity with security best practices and compliance frameworks relevant to cloud environments, such as NIST 800-53/CSF, CCM, etc.      Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot complex technical issues in cloud infrastructure.      Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment.      Extreme proficiency with technical and managerial documentation.                  Bonus Skills          Microsoft Azure certifications such as Azure Security Engineer Associate, Identity and Access Administrator, Security Operations Analyst, and Cybersecurity Architect Expert.      Working knowledge of emerging Microsoft security technologies such as Security Copilot.      Technology consulting background

column2: The Cloud Security Specialist drives security strategy and architecture for our cloud initiatives, combining technical expertise with strategic thinking. They collaborate across teams as a Subject Matter Expert, promoting Everything as Code and empowering teams to tackle cloud security challenges proactively.                           ?           Role and      Responsibilities:                           Provide     expert level guidance to      facilitate     the implementation and evolution of secure cloud and container architectures, including robust controls and best practices across various cloud service models such as IaaS, PaaS, SaaS, and hybrid configurations.                     Assist     in the evolution of continuous monitoring solutions to      validate     systems against security baselines, promptly respond to policy violations, and ensure adherence to security standards and compliance requirements.                     Identify     , evaluate, and propose innovative technology solutions for cloud and container environments aimed at enhancing process efficiency, automation, security, environment visibility, developer enablement, and streamlining processes.                     Collaborate proactively with developers, system administrators, and IT management to ensure that security controls and processes align with company directives and goals, promoting secure-by-design principles.                     Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement secure cloud architectures, encompassing network security,      identity     and access management (IAM), data encryption, and other essential security controls.                     Ensure compliance with relevant security standards, regulations, and frameworks (eg, GDPR, HIPAA, ISO 27001) across all cloud-based initiatives and deployments.                     Explore opportunities to introduce automation and innovative technologies in cloud security processes, aiming to enhance efficiency, reduce manual efforts, and strengthen overall security posture.                     Provide input into the design and deployment of automated security solutions,      leveraging         expertise     to enhance the efficacy and scalability of security measures.                     Provide guidance and training to internal teams on cloud security best practices, emerging threats, and security awareness to foster a culture of security across the organization.                     Analyze the latest attacker techniques and implement solutions to mitigate associated risks, ensuring the resilience of cloud environments against evolving threats.                     Stay abreast of the latest cybersecurity threats and trends, proactively      identifying     potential vulnerabilities and recommending proactive measures to mitigate risks.                                       Requirements:                           bachelors degree in computer science, Information Technology, or      Technology      related field. Advanced degree or relevant certifications (eg, CISSP, CCSP, AWS Certified Security - Specialty) preferred.                     Seven     years of experience      in one, or a combination, of network, application, cloud, or infrastructure security      domain,          showcasing     a comprehensive understanding of security principles and practices         .                     Demonstrated      expertise     in cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud, including a deep understanding of security features such as IAM, VPC, Security Groups, and encryption      services.                                 Strong familiarity with networking concepts, protocols, and security principles, enabling the design and implementation of secure network architectures.                     Demonstrated experience in cloud-native architectures, microservices, and operational best practices in cloud and container      orchestration.                     Experience integrating enterprise-scale security solutions in AWS and/or Azure, encompassing user, security, and networking configurations to ensure robust security postures     .                     Proficiency     in full stack cloud automation using tools like Git, Terraform, Ansible, and Jenkins, with past programming experience,      and knowledge of Python is a plus     .                     Experience aligning security programs with industry benchmarks and standards such as NIST, CIS, FIPS, PCI DSS, HIPAA, and FIPS 140-2, ensuring adherence to best practices.                     Strong understanding of IT Risk Management, Security Policies and Procedures, Internal Audit, and Compliance Standards. Familiarity with SOC, FFIEC, CSA, and FedRAMP is a      plus.                     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and capability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. column2: Senior DevOps Engineer Job Description The Senior DevOps Engineer (SDE) role is a key function in the DevOps organization. An employee holding this position is most likely to be an engineer with considerable professional experience in DevOps. The SDE is expected to be able to turn their hand to any part of the DevOps lifecycle from software delivery pipeline, supporting software engineering through to delivery to Production. They are expected to be able to apply professional experience and implement and enhance our build, deployment and operational management tooling, executing it in all environments, including Production and taking feedback from that process and folding it back into the improvements backlog.  The DevOps team is aggressively adopting new technologies and architectural principles, as well as approaches to delivery, deployment, scalability and monitoring. The successful candidate is expected to be a good technologist  a mix of software engineering and technical operations backgrounds is advantageous. Reporting Lines: Reports to:  Lead DevOps Engineer Location: Bangalore Note: Our office works in a hybrid model. As per policy this role is required to work from office 2 mandatory days in a week. Will be called on during ??ut of office??hours to support production issue resolution as well as provide on call rota support. column2: As a GCP (Google Cloud Platform) Cloud Engineer, your role revolves around designing, implementing, and managing cloud-based solutions on Google Cloud Platform. Here's an overview of your responsibilities and tasks: Cloud Architecture Design: You design scalable, secure, and cost-effective cloud architectures on GCP to meet the requirements of your clients or organization. This involves selecting appropriate GCP services and resources such as compute instances, storage solutions, databases, networking components, and security services. Infrastructure as Code (IaC): You utilize infrastructure as code tools and frameworks such as Terraform, Google Cloud Deployment Manager, or Google Cloud SDK to automate the provisioning and management of GCP resources. This enables infrastructure configurations to be defined, version-controlled, and deployed programmatically. Compute and Networking: You deploy and manage compute instances (VMs), containers (using Google Kubernetes Engine - GKE), and serverless applications (using Google Cloud Functions or Cloud Run) on GCP. You configure and optimize networking components such as Virtual Private Cloud (VPC), subnets, routes, load balancers, and VPN connections to ensure secure and efficient communication between cloud resources. Storage and Databases: You leverage GCP storage services such as Google Cloud Storage (GCS), Cloud SQL, Cloud Spanner, Bigtable, and Firestore to store and manage data effectively. You design and implement scalable, highly available, and durable storage solutions to meet the performance and reliability requirements of your applications. Security and Identity Management: You implement security best practices and controls to protect GCP resources and data from unauthorized access, data breaches, and other security threats. This includes configuring identity and access management (IAM) policies, encryption, key management, logging, and monitoring solutions to ensure compliance with security standards and regulations. Monitoring and Logging: You set up monitoring and logging solutions on GCP using tools such as Google Cloud Monitoring, Stackdriver Logging, and Stackdriver Trace to track the performance, availability, and health of cloud resources and applications. You create custom dashboards, alerts, and notifications to proactively detect and respond to incidents. Deployment and Automation: You build CI/CD pipelines to automate the deployment, testing, and delivery of software applications on GCP. This involves integrating version control systems (e.g., Git), build tools (e.g., Jenkins), and artifact repositories (e.g., Google Container Registry) to enable continuous integration and continuous deployment workflows. Cost Optimization: You optimize cloud resource usage and costs on GCP by implementing cost management strategies such as rightsizing instances, using preemptible VMs, leveraging auto-scaling capabilities, and analyzing billing reports and usage trends to identify opportunities for cost savings. Disaster Recovery and Business Continuity: You design and implement disaster recovery (DR) and business continuity (BC) solutions on GCP to minimize downtime and data loss in the event of outages or disasters. This may involve replicating data across multiple regions, configuring backup and restore mechanisms, and implementing failover procedures. Documentation and Knowledge Sharing: You create documentation, runbooks, and knowledge base articles to document cloud architectures, configurations, and best practices. You share your expertise and insights with colleagues and stakeholders through training sessions, workshops, and technical presentations to promote knowledge sharing and collaboration.
column11: GCP, Cloud SQL, Cloud Spanner, Jenkins, Networking, Cloud Architecture, CI/CD, VPC, Google Cloud Monitoring

column2: As a Live Site Engineer, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth operation and availability of our companys live production environment.          You will be responsible for monitoring, maintaining, and optimizing the performance of our systems to deliver a reliable and uninterrupted experience to our customers.          Your expertise and problem-solving skills will be vital in quickly identifying and resolving any issues that may arise, minimizing downtime and maximizing customer satisfaction.           What you ll be doing           Monitor the live production environment to proactively identify potential issues or anomalies.         Respond promptly to system alerts, incidents, or outages, and take appropriate actions to resolve them.         Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, system administrators, and network engineers, to troubleshoot and resolve complex issues.         Be the central point of contact for incidents providing periodic updates to stakeholders.         Prepare and deliver incident reports to customers.         Develop and maintain automation scripts, tools, and monitoring dashboards to streamline operational tasks and improve efficiency.         Implement proactive monitoring and alerting mechanisms to ensure early detection of system issues.         Participate in an on-call rotation to provide 24/7 support for production systems.         Respond to and resolve critical incidents during on-call shifts in a timely manner.           What we want from you         Need to have           Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).         Proven experience working as a Live Site Engineer, Site Reliability Engineer, or in a similar role.         Strong knowledge of Linux/Unix systems, networking concepts, and web technologies.         Proficiency in scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash) for automation and tooling.         Experience with monitoring and alerting tools (e.g., Nagios, Splunk, Datadog, Prometheus, Grafana).         Experience      Familiarity      with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).         Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think quickly and prioritize effectively in high-pressure situations.         Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.         Desire to grow in your technical skills beyond incident command.           Nice to have           Experience in fraud or bot mitigation domain         Experience using tools like FireHydran

The Azure AD Administrator provides technical expertise and support for the company s on-premises and cloud-based Identity and Access Management (IAM) solutions. Systems include Microsoft Active Directory, Azure Active Directory, SSO (Single Sign On), and Azure Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA), Identity Governance (SailPoint Identity Now), CyberArk PAM and Conjur key vault. The analyst will be a member of the Identity Management team that also manages DNS/DHCP, IP address management, Certificate Authority, Application Delivery controllers, Web Application Firewalls and various provisioning other automation and monitoring tools. This is a highly collaborative team that interfaces with all support teams across Enterprise. We are closely integrated with IT Security to implement security improvements and controls for the company.      Responsibilities for this role include:    Support and manage day to day IAM systems, identity lifecycle, authentication support, system health checks.    Develop and maintain identity security policies, scripts and tools.    Collaborate, participate in incident response and investigations as needed to identify the root cause of security incidents and prevent their recurrence.    Design, Deploy, and maintain identity controls across multiple cloud platforms.    Configure Federated Services, Single Sign On (SSO), MFA, and cloud application registrations.    SailPoint IdentityNow provisioning, Cloud Access Management integration and administration.    Ensure compliance with information security policies, standards, and best practices.    Implement authorization and access management solutions such as LDAP, Kerberos, SAML, OAuth, and Open ID Connect for various Business requirements.    Develop Microsoft PowerShell scripts to perform reporting and automation functions.    Employer-provided

column2: ?       You will have the day-to-day responsibility for the TORM environment running in an Azure cloud.     TORM operates with a Microsoft-based environment and uses Windows server as well as Microsoft SQL server. Microsoft's BI stack plays a significant role in the day-to-day decision support of TORM's business units, and BizTalk is responsible for the integration between the business systems. We use Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for our cloud adoption.     You will be responsible for providing ownership and leadership in Azure architecture, cloud deployment, administration, managing Azure solutions as well as the storage, identity, governance, virtual networks, security, and computing in a cloud environment all in cooperation with specialized colleagues in Group IT.       Your primary tasks:          Define high-level migration plans to address the gaps between the current and future state.      Architecting and implementing Azure Cloud cost effective solutions for non-production environment such as Disaster Recovery, Development, Testing servers.      Managing and deploying Azure solutions.     Using PowerShell to deploy resources and repeatable deployments with ARM templates.      Explore configuring hybrid connectivity between on-premises environments and Azure, and how to monitor network performance to comply with service-level agreements.      Automating Deployment and Scale of Azure IaaS Solution script, automate, and scale Azure deployments.      Install and configure Virtual Machines, Storage Account, Virtual Network Load Balancer in the Azure Cloud.     Configure Virtual Machine Scale Sets to optimize the performance of Application.     Consult on Azure native technology capabilities.     Assist with Azure Cost estimation.     Debugging and troubleshooting of issues/opening tickets with Microsoft     Manage, monitor, and report resource utilization on daily basis. Including but not limited to scaling vertical and horizontal.         Your background and experience       Professionally, you have 7-10 years of operational experience with optimizing the performance of Microsoft products (Windows Server, SQL Server, Active Directory) and clear understanding of core Cloud Computing services. You need to understand the basic functioning of Networking, Databases, Software, and Servers in the Cloud. You need to have a good understanding of security in a Microsoft environment, including Kerberos. You have excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to communicate complex IT information in simplified form depending on the target audience, and you have the drive to improve and do proactive research around emerging technologies/new iterations of MS Azure.     You have a good understanding of enterprise change management processes.     You are experienced with scripting (PowerShell) and can see how automation of operational tasks can contribute to the value-creation and operational excellence.     As a person you are structured, proactive, and good at prioritizing. You are defined by taking ownership of your assignments, can work independently while also achieving results through connecting with others. You are fluent in English both verbally and in writing.       We offer       As an employee in TORM, you will be part of a leading, world-class shipping company. Our corporate culture is characterized by well-defined values and an informal, but performance-oriented working environment.     We offer a competitive salary which will reflect your experience and qualifications, and an attractive benefits package including bonus and pension.     We are an international team, built on common values embracing innovation, diversity, mutual respect, passion to make a positive difference, accountability, commitment to excellence, and teamwork. We believe in the importance of personal and professional development.     Working at TORM can be challenging, but it is also rewarding and inspiring as we work continually on securing a safe, pleasant, and ergonomic work environment. Our ambition is for you to find a good balance between your work and your private life. Whatever your function at TORM will be, your contribution will make a difference.     ?

Can deploy infrastructure and platform environments, creates a proof of architecture to test architecture viability, security and performance.  Must have skills : Data Modeling Techniques and Methodologies Good to have skills : NA Minimum  3  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : A Engineering graduate preferably Computer Science graduate 15 years of full time education Summary :As a Cloud Platform Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building, testing, and deploying cloud application solutions that integrate cloud and non-cloud infrastructure. Your typical day will involve deploying infrastructure and platform environments, creating a proof of architecture to test architecture viability, security, and performance.  Roles & Responsibilities: Design, build, test, and deploy cloud application solutions that integrate cloud and non-cloud infrastructure. Deploy infrastructure and platform environments, creating a proof of architecture to test architecture viability, security, and performance. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure successful delivery of cloud-based solutions. Stay updated with the latest advancements in cloud technologies and integrate innovative approaches for sustained competitive advantage. Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Strong experience in Data Modeling Techniques and Methodologies. Good To Have Skills:Experience in cloud technologies such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform. Experience in deploying infrastructure and platform environments. Experience in creating a proof of architecture to test architecture viability, security, and performance. Experience in collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure successful delivery of cloud-based solutions. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 3 years of experience in Data Modeling Techniques and Methodologies. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful cloud-based solutions. This position is based at our Bengaluru office. Qualification A Engineering graduate preferably Computer Science graduate 15 years of full time education

column2: Job Posting: Senior Cloud Platform Engineer ABOUT COMPANY Cadient Talent is a high-growth SaaS Talent Acquisition software provider focused exclusively on providing the industry?s leading end-to-end hiring solution for distributed workforces. Built specifically for the field, our intuitive and flexible platform meets the complex needs of high-volume, hourly hiring and provides managers with a constant pipeline of quality candidates. Your Impact OR Responsibilities: ? Combine your technical expertise and problem-solving passion to work closely with development and product teams, turning complex ideas into end-to-end solutions that transform our clients? business. ? Lead and support the implementation of the Engineering side of Digital Business Transformations with cloud, multi-cloud, security, observability, and DevOps as technology enablers. ? Responsible for Building an Immutable Infrastructure and maintaining highly scalable, secure, and reliable cloud infrastructure, which is optimized for performance cost, and compliant with security standards to prevent security breaches. ? Enable our customers to accelerate their software development lifecycle and reduce the time to market for their products or services. Your Skills Experience:  ? 5 to 9 years of experience in Cloud & DevOps with Full time Bachelor?s /Master?s degree(Science  or Engineering preferred)  ? Expertise in below DevOps & Cloud tools:  ? Expertise in at least one Cloud Must-have  ? Azure (Virtual Machines, Azure Active Directory, Virtual Network, Blob Storage,  Functions, Database, Azure Service Bus, Azure Monitor)  ? AWS (EC2, IAM, VPC, S3, Lambda, RDS, SNS, Cloud Watch)  ? Configuration and monitoring DNS, APP Servers, Load Balancer, and Firewall for high-volume  ? Traffic  ? Troubleshooting and resolving production issues.  ? Well-versed with virtual private networks, VPN, and firewalls. Extensive experience in designing, implementing, and maintaining infrastructure as code using  preferably Terraform or Cloud Formation/ARM Templates/Deployment Manager/ Pulumi.  ? Experience Managing Container Infrastructure (Managed e.g., AKS, EKS, or GKE)  ? Design, implement and Upgrade container infrastructure e.g., K8S Cluster & Node Pools  ? Create and maintain deployment manifest files for microservices using HELM or YAML.  ? Utilize service mesh Istio to create gateways, virtual services, traffic routing and fault  injection.  ? Troubleshoot and resolve container infrastructure & deployment issues.  ? System Administration  ? Linux and Windows System Administration  ? Scripting ? bash / PowerShell / python  ? Continues Integration & Continues Deployment  ? Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines for software delivery using Git and tools such as Azure  DevOps, Jenkins, GitLab, Bamboo.  ? Automate build, test, and deployment processes to ensure efficient release cycles and  enforce software development best practices e.g., Quality Gates, Vulnerability Scans etc.  ? Automate Build and Deployment process using Groovy, Shell and PowerShell  ? Manage container registries such Azure container registries, azure repos and GitHub for  version control and release management.  ? Design, implement, and maintain observability, monitoring, logging and alerting using below  tools.  ? Logging: Elastic Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana), Fluentd, Splunk  ? Monitoring: Zabbix, Prometheus, Grafana  ? Excellent communication  EDUCATION:  BTech or MTech in Computer Science, IT with at least 60% throughout academics.  INTERESTED?  Kindly share your resume at Aarti.yadav@cadienttalent.com  HYBRID WORK CULTURE: 2-3 Days from the Office  LOCATION:  Sector 62, Noida INDIA     Regards Aarti Yadav - HR Team

column2: We are looking for an Associate Cloud Support Engineer to work in our 1st shift 8AM-4PM EST (6:30PM-2:30AM IST/ 6PM-2AM PKT, 2nd shift 4PM-12AM EST(1:30AM-9:30AM IST/1:00AM-9AM PKT) OR 3rd shift 12AM-8AM (9:30AM-5:30PM IST/ 9AM-5PM PKT)       As a Cloud Support Engineer, you'll work both independently and collaboratively with your team to troubleshoot and resolve highly-technical issues that customers encounter while using our platform     you'll partner cross-functionally with our product and engineering teams to drive feedback, improve internal & external tooling, launch new products & features, and deliver an exceptional customer experience          What you'll Be Doing:           Troubleshooting and resolving technical support requests created by our customers spanning a growing range of container products and services, including Managed Kubernetes and Container Registry         Serving as the primary point of contact for escalations, working closely with our product and engineering teams to respond to and resolve customer-impacting incidents         Building internal documentation that provides your team with the resources they need to perform in their role and external documentation that allows our customers to self-serve         Representing the voice of support, speaking on behalf of our customers through direct engagement with our product and engineering teams.         Engaging customers and responding to technical questions received through our community Q&A forum           What We'll Expect From You:           Advanced knowledge of Kubernetes with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve issues and escalations ranging from pods and deployments to the control plane.         Proven experience in Customer support and handling the customers while troubleshooting the technical issues.         Highly self-motivated with the ability to work independently and collaboratively with a high degree of autonomy in a remote work environment         Growth mindset, with an unrelenting focus on continuously improving your knowledge and skill set.           What Excites Us:           Contributing to Open Source and giving back to the community         Why you'll Like Working for DigitalOcean     :         we'reward our employees     . The base salary range for this position is based on relevant years of experience and skills. The salary range for this role is specific to candidates located within the U.S. and will vary for candidates outside the U.S.. Employees may qualify for a bonus in addition to base salary; bonus amounts are determined based on company and individual performance. We also provide equity compensation to eligible employees including grants of equity upon hire and the option to participate in our Employee Stock Purchase Program.         We value development.     You will work with some of the smartest and most interesting people in the industry. We are a high-performance organization that is always challenging our teams and employees to continuously grow. We maintain a growth mindset in everything we do and invest deeply in employee development through formalized mentorship and other internal programs. We provide all employees with reimbursement for relevant conferences, training, and education.         We care about your well-being.      In addition to cash and equity compensation, we also offer employees a competitive array of benefits. In the United States, these include health insurance, flexible vacation, retirement benefits, a generous parental leave program, and additional resources to support employees overall well-being. While the philosophy around our benefits is the same worldwide, specific benefits may vary in other countries due to local regulations and preferences.         We value diversity and inclusivity.     We are an equal opportunity employer and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
column11: Health insurance, Cloud computing, Employee development, Cloud, Equity, Customer support, Customer experience, Management, Open source, Technical support

column2: Dear All, We have opening for System Administration Linux Interested candidate with relevant experience can apply for this position with following details Current CTC Expected CTC Notice Period Please mention subject line position name while sending resume on mail.   Server installation and configuration: Installing and configuring Linux servers based on the organization's requirements, including selecting the appropriate Linux distribution, setting up the network, and configuring basic server services. User management: Creating and managing user accounts, groups, and permissions on Linux servers, ensuring proper access control and security. Package management: Managing software packages using package management tools specific to the Linux distribution, such as yum or apt-get, including package installation, updates, and removal. System monitoring: Monitoring server health, resource utilization, and performance metrics, such as CPU usage, memory utilization, disk space, and network traffic. Responding to system alerts and taking appropriate actions. Basic troubleshooting: Identifying and resolving basic issues related to Linux server operations, such as startup failures, connectivity problems, or software configuration errors. File system management and LVM management: Creating and managing file systems, mounting and unmounting, setting file permissions, and managing disk space. Managing disk partitions, monitoring disk health, and optimizing disk space utilization. Backup and recovery: Implementing backup strategies for data and configuration files, performing regular backups, and ensuring the ability to restore the system in case of failures or data loss. Security management: Implementing security measures on Linux servers, including firewall configuration, user authentication mechanisms, access control lists (ACLs), and security patches, OS Hardening based on VAPT Report on quarterly basis, as per the Bank Policy Scripting and automation: Developing and maintaining shell scripts or automation tools to streamline administrative tasks, automate routine procedures, and improve operational efficiency. System performance tuning: Analyzing system performance, optimizing kernel parameters, and fine-tuning server configurations to improve performance and stability. Network configuration: Configuring network interfaces, IP addressing, DNS settings, and network services on Linux servers. Service management: Managing and configuring system services, including starting, stopping, and monitoring services, such as web servers (Apache or Nginx), database servers (MySQL or PostgreSQL), and email servers. System upgrades and patch management: Planning and executing system upgrades, including kernel updates, security patches, and software version upgrades. Documentation and reporting: Maintaining documentation related to server configurations, procedures, troubleshooting steps, and any changes made to the system. Providing regular reports on server health, performance, and incidents to the appropriate stakeholders. Ensure systems team support requests are answered within one business day. Respond rapidly to system maintenance needs, including on weekends and evenings. Assist with managing our VMware infrastructure, NetApp, Hitachi, DELL SAN  D  oud Infrastructure As A Service / Cloud Platform As a Service (Azure / GCP / AWS)D
column11: Redhat Linux, linux, RHEL

column2: Job Scope: As an HPC Admin L3, you will be responsible for the provisioning, management, and maintenance of GPU Supercomputing clusters on NVIDIA reference architecture. You will ensure optimal performance and uptime of these critical systems, supporting high-performance computing (HPC) requirements.     Job Responsibilities: Provision, configure,      and maintain GPU Supercomputing clusters and associated networking configuration. Collaborate with      NVIDIA Solution Architect & Engineering teams on large-scale GPU-as-a-service      projects, both on-premises and in cloud deployments. Implement and optimize      software stacks including MaaS (metal-as-a-service), Job Scheduler      (SLURM/PBS), Cloud Orchestration (Kubernetes), and Network Management      (NetQ for Ethernet fabric and UFM for InfiniBand). Conduct performance      engineering activities such as debugging, profiling, benchmarking, and      tuning of GPU applications on large-scale supercomputing clusters. Run benchmarking      applications from widely used platforms such as MLPerf Training &      Inference, AI Training (PyTorch, TensorFlow, NeMo, Megatron-LM), and AI      Inference (TensorRT-LLM, Triton Inference Server, vLLM). Must-Have Skill: Hands-on experience      with NVIDIA GPU , particularly NVIDIA Data Centre GPUs (A100/H100) Proficiency in      provisioning and managing software stacks like MaaS, Job Scheduler      (SLURM/PBS), Cloud Orchestration (Kubernetes), and Network Management      (NetQ for Ethernet fabric and UFM for InfiniBand). Prior experience      collaborating with NVIDIA Solution Architect & Engineering teams on      large-scale GPU-as-a-service projects. Familiarity with      benchmarking applications from widely used platforms and frameworks,      including MLPerf, PyTorch, TensorFlow, NeMo, Megatron-LM, TensorRT-LLM,      Triton Inference Server, and vLLM. Experience in      performance engineering, including debugging, profiling, benchmarking, and      tuning various GPU applications on large-scale supercomputing clusters. Good to Have Skill: Knowledge of other HPC      technologies and architectures beyond NVIDIA, broadening expertise in the      field. Good knowledge on      Infiniband and other switches. Experience with other      cloud platforms and orchestration tools, expanding versatility in      deployment environments. Strong problem-solving      and troubleshooting abilities, enabling quick resolution of complex      technical issues. Excellent      communication and collaboration skills to work effectively within      cross-functional teams and with external partners. Behavioral Attributes: Strong problem-solving      skills with a proactive and solution-oriented approach. Excellent      communication and collaboration skills for effective customer support. Adaptability to handle      a dynamic and fast-paced cloud administration environment. Commitment to security      best practices and continuous improvement. Qualification and Experience: Bachelors degree in      Engineering, or equivalent. Minimum 10 years      experience in IT, 5+ years of relevant experience in HPC engineering      roles, with a focus on NVIDIA GPU and Networking Technologies. Demonstrated success      in deploying and managing large-scale GPU Supercomputing clusters,      preferably in collaboration with NVIDIA teams. Proven track record of performance engineering activities and optimizing GPU applications for high-performance computing workloads
column11: Maas, AI Training PyTorch, Megatron-LM, NeMo, TensorFlow
