column2: Job Location - Airoli / Panvel.   Job Scope: As a Cloud Administrator, you will be at the forefront of managing, administering, and monitoring our cloud infrastructure. Your responsibilities will cover a broad spectrum, including the implementation, troubleshooting, and customer support aspects of technologies such as OpenStack, KVM, Kubernetes, Docker, Linux clustering, Prometheus, Zabbix, and more. Your role will be pivotal in ensuring the stability, security, and performance of our cloud environment. Job Responsibilities: Configure, and maintain cloud solutions      based on OpenStack, KVM, Kubernetes, Docker, and Linux clustering. Administer and troubleshoot the      day-to-day operations of our cloud infrastructure. Monitor system performance, ensuring      high availability and optimal resource utilization. Provide expert-level support for      customer issues, ensuring timely resolution and customer satisfaction. Lead efforts to optimize and automate      routine administrative tasks. Perform system upgrades, patches, and      ensure system compliance. Collaborate with vendors and other      stakeholders for issue resolution and system enhancements. Must-Have Skill: Proven experience in administering cloud      technologies, particularly OpenStack, KVM, Kubernetes, and Docker. Strong troubleshooting skills and the ability      to diagnose and resolve complex issues. Experience in Linux clustering solutions for      high availability. Proficiency in monitoring tools such as      Prometheus and Zabbix. Customer-centric mindset with the ability to      provide high-quality support. In-depth knowledge of virtualization      technologies and cloud administration. Good to Have Skill: Familiarity with other cloud platforms like      AWS, Azure, or GCP. Knowledge of software-defined networking (SDN)      concepts. Understanding of microservices architecture      and serverless computing. Behavioral Attributes: Strong problem-solving skills with a proactive      and solution-oriented approach. Excellent communication and collaboration      skills for effective customer support. Adaptability to handle a dynamic and      fast-paced cloud administration environment. Commitment to security best practices and      continuous improvement. Qualification and Experience: Bachelors degree in Engineering or      equivalent. Minimum 6 years experience in IT, 4+ years of      relevant experience in cloud administration. Certifications in relevant areas (e.g.,      OpenStack Certified Administrator) will be an advantage.

column2: This role will support the existing cloud-based production environments of our clients while providing assistance to development teams as requested for cloud services        For production environments, this will include the handling of support tickets, regular maintenance and updates to client environments, applying mitigation strategies to known issues, and handling urgent outages      For assistance to development teams, this can include providing consultation on infrastructure architecture design and configuration, to include creating relevant artifacts, as well as cost estimations for cloud-based hosting      This role includes ownership of technical, commercial, and service elements related to cloud project engagements      The successful applicant will be able to work independently under the provided policies and procedures while providing clear communications to the technical and support teams they assist                        Responsibilities:                              Role responsibilities for this position include:                                Ability to create artifacts for cloud infrastructure projects to include migration strategies, roadmaps, business cases and transformation recommendations.                          Design and build end-to-end hybrid DC and Cloud solutions for multiple types of service offerings and/or technology offerings.                          Manage production operation and support of multiple client cloud environments within: AWS, AZURE or GCP.                              Assess infrastructure requirements for new client projects and existing environments and provide cost estimates based on current vendor pricings.                              Work independently to address client tickets within contractual SLAs for timeliness in handling of support tickets.                          Handling of the creation and configuration of client cloud environments consistent with the productivity      and financial performance objectives of the project. This also includes the handling of      internal team environments.                          Provide routine maintenance, upgrades, and improvements for client production environments and internal team environments.                          Efficient and effective communication, both verbal and written to facilitate issue resolution and complex infrastructure design discussions.                              Assess and provide a variety of technology solutions to support client and company infrastructure needs while providing pros and cons of each technology to enable business decision making choices.                          Manage standards, procedures, and practices for record keeping of contractual agreements and well internal IT Cloud strategy                          Identify potential project risks and incorporate risk mitigation strategy and contingency plan                              Continued professional development and growth by staying in touch with latest technology offerings and trends as well as proper industry procedures and standards.                                  Qualifications:                              5+ years of infrastructure engineering experience                          Infrastructure Transition and/or Data Center Migration to the Cloud experience                              Experience in two or more of the industry common cloud hosting environments: AWS, AZURE or GCP, as well as the development and configuration of new infrastructures within those environments.                          Experience in managing the production operation and support of one or more types of technology solutions to include custom development applications, IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS.                              Experience in designing and creating architecture diagrams/artifacts to be used for both business and technical teams. This includes artifacts and designs pertaining to:                              AS-IS to TO-BE Transformation Mappings and Roadmaps                          The different architectural layers (e.g., Network, Storage, Databases, etc.)                          Virtualization technologies (e.g., VMware, Hyper-V, Nutanix, Containers, LPAR, etc.)                          Cloud migration strategies (i.e., Public, Hybrid, or Private cloud)                          Security components                                      Deep knowledge of On-Prem technologies like KVM, VMWare, Nutanix, converged architecture, Hyper converged infrastructure, and Private Cloud technologies, etc.                              Experience working within both project-centric and project matrix resourcing models                          Experience in working with support tickets under defined SLAs.                          Exposure to the full procurement life cycle (e.g., working with third parties to receive quotations, assisting in the commercial aspects of procuring data center related hardware and/or licensing, etc.)                          Excellent communication skills in both verbal and written communication.                          Familiar with ITIL processes.

column2: We are seeking a highly skilled Cloud Infrastructure Engineer with expertise in AWS and GCP to join our team. column2: Please apply using the URL:? https://atlas.bamboohr.com/careers/367 Job Description: Opera Cloud Resource Position Overview:  We are seeking a skilled Opera Cloud Resource to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing and maintaining our Opera Cloud system, ensuring its optimal performance and functionality. As a key member of our hospitality team, the candidate will play a crucial role in supporting our hotel operations and delivering exceptional guest experiences through efficient use of the Opera Cloud platform. Key Responsibilities: Manage and administer the Opera Cloud system, including configuration, customization, and maintenance tasks. Provide technical support and troubleshooting assistance to end-users and hotel staff on Opera Cloud-related issues and inquiries. Implement and monitor system integrations with other hotel management systems, ensuring seamless data flow and synchronization. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement system enhancements, upgrades, and new features to meet business requirements. Develop and maintain system documentation, user manuals, and training materials to facilitate user adoption and knowledge transfer. Conduct regular system audits and performance reviews to identify opportunities for optimization and improvement. Stay informed about industry trends, best practices, and new developments in hotel management technology, specifically related to Opera Cloud. Act as a liaison between the hotel management team and the Opera Cloud vendor to escalate and resolve technical issues and enhancement requests. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in information technology, Hospitality Management, or related field. Minimum of 2-3 years of hands-on experience with Opera Cloud system administration and support. Strong technical proficiency in Opera Cloud configuration, customization, and troubleshooting. Familiarity with hotel operations and hospitality industry standards and practices. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with diverse teams and stakeholders. Proven ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Certifications or training in Opera Cloud administration or hospitality technology preferred.

column2: As we embark on our journey to migrate our cloud services from Microsoft Azure to Amazon Web Services (AWS), we're seeking a dedicated Cloud Tester with a keen eye for detail. This role is                                 critical to ensuring the correct functioning of downstream systems, appropriate routing of APIs, and the smooth operation of both Azure and AWS infrastructures during and after the migration process.                                       Responsibilities                                         Develop and execute test plans and test cases for validating the correct routing of APIs, and the functionality of downstream systems.                                     Verify the integrity of AWS and Azure infrastructures, including service configurations, data storage solutions, and networking settings                                     Identify, record, and track defects, and work with the development and cloud engineering teams to coordinate defect resolution.                                     Review and analyze system specifications to ensure the cloud migration adheres to design and operational requirements                                     Actively participate in all phases of the migration process, focusing on quality assurance of cloud configurations, services, and features                                     Engage in functional, integration, regression and performance testing of cloud services and components                                     Generate testing reports and metrics for management review                                     Collaborate with other QA members, developers, and system engineers to ensure testing standards are met                                     Stay current with new cloud technologies, testing tools, and strategies to improve the testing process.

column1: Senior Cloud Network Engineer  - Azure / AWS / GCP
column2: Hiring,  Senior Cloud Network Engineer Position summary   We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Cloud Networking Engineer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of cloud networking technologies, architecture, and best practices. As a Senior Cloud Networking Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in designing, implementing, and optimizing our cloud networking   infrastructure to ensure the highest levels of performance, security, and scalability.  Primary Responsibilities    Manage our cloud networking architecture across multiple cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud. Develop and maintain network security measures in collaboration with our security team, including firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems, VPNs (Virtual Private Network), and encryption techniques, to safeguard sensitive data and applications. Create, standardize, and maintain detailed documentation of the physical and logical network topology.  Monitor, maintain and document trends related to the global cloud network for faults, performance, and capacity. Troubleshoot network/incidents problems. This includes on-call responsibilities. Participate in a formal incident rapid response process for priority incidents.  Participate in capacity planning to accommodate current and future workload demands. Participate in scheduled maintenance, outage response, last minute urgent requests. Make proactive recommendations for changes to the global network environment. Collaborate with DevOps and development teams to support continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines. Stay current with industry trends and emerging cloud networking technologies and assess their potential impact on our environment.  Follow and enforce Change Management guidelines and processes. Communicate with colleagues, management, customers, vendors, and others in a courteous, professional manner. Perform other related duties as assigned.   Knowledge, Skills, and Behaviors   Ability to take initiative, and exercise professional, independent judgment to plan work, formulate recommendations, and make sound   decisions.  Effective communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present complex technical information to non-technical   stakeholders. Proven   experience in designing and implementing complex cloud networking architectures, including hybrid and multi-cloud environments. Network   monitoring, maintenance, and optimization. Bonus: Experience with monitoring   tools like Site24x7, OpsManager. Dynamic routing protocols BGP, EIGRP, OSPF Understanding   of Azure DevOps, CI/CD and Terraform   QUALIFICATIONS   BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience, with a focus on networking. 6+ years of   experience in supporting network environments at an enterprise scale. 3+ years of data networking design, installation operation and support in a distributed   environment 3+ years of hands-on experience in cloud networking with a focus on at least one major   cloud platform (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud). Professional certification such as the CCDP, CCNP, CCNA, CCDE, Azure Certified Network   Engineer or equivalent.
column11: Azure, Cloud Networking Architecture, Enterprise Network Operations, Azure Cloud, Azure Cloud Design, cloud networking   infrastructure, Network Design, BGP, EIGRP, Network Infrastructure, Terraform, multi-cloud, CI/CD, Azure Cloud Services, AWS, Azure DevOps, OSPF

column2: Cloud Engineer is responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining an organization's cloud computing infrastructure. They work with cloud-based platforms, such as AWS or Azure, to ensure that the infrastructure is secure, scalable, and cost-effective.        The ideal candidate for this role should have a strong understanding of cloud computing concepts and experience with AWS and Azure. They should also have experience with scripting and automation, and excellent problem-solving skills. Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools, such as Terraform or CloudFormation, is also highly desirable.     This role requires a combination of technical expertise and business acumen, as the Cloud Engineer is responsible for ensuring the organization's cloud infrastructure meets its technical and financial goals. Strong communication and collaboration skills are also important, as the Cloud Engineer will work closely with developers, other technical teams, and senior management.       Responsibilities      Deploying and configuring cloud infrastructure using AWS and Azure.     Implementing security measures such as encryption, access controls, and backups to protect the organization's data and systems.     Assisting in the automation of infrastructure deployment and management using tools like Terraform or CloudFormation.     Collaborating with developers to design, build, and deploy applications on the cloud, ensuring they are secure, scalable, and cost-effective.     Participating in disaster recovery planning and testing to ensure the availability and reliability of the organization's systems and data in the event of an outage.     Monitoring cloud resource utilization and costs and providing reports to senior management to optimize the organization's spending.     Staying up-to-date with the latest advancements and technologies in cloud computing and DevOps.     Troubleshooting issues related to cloud infrastructure and applications, working with other teams and vendors as needed.     Documenting systems, processes, and procedures to ensure knowledge is shared and retained within the organization.       The responsibilities of a Cloud Engineer with 0-2 years of experience may vary depending on the size and scope of the project and the needs of the client or company they are working for.       Requirement      Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.     Hands-on experience with AWS and Azure cloud platforms.     Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools, such as Terraform or CloudFormation.     Knowledge of security and data protection measures such as encryption, access controls, and backups.     Experience with automation and scripting, such as Python, Bash, or Perl.     Familiarity with containerization and container orchestration technologies, such as Docker and Kubernetes.     Knowledge of networking concepts, such as subnets, routing, and firewalls.     Ability to work in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment.     Excellent communication and collaboration skills, as the Cloud Engineer will work closely with developers, other technical teams, and senior management.     Passion for learning and staying up-to-date with the latest advancements and technologies in cloud computing and DevOps.     Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
column11: container, kubernetes, python, orchestration, microsoft azure, networking, aws cloudformation, azure cloud, docker, containerization, scripting, automation, iam, devops, cloud infrastructure, terraform, bash, perl, aws, cloud computing, communication skills

column1: Cloud Hosting Support Engineer Level - L1
column2: Cloud Hosting is a global program that demonstrates virtualization technology to manage project engineering systems at multiple centers     The Cloud Hosting Centers Engineer L-1 is responsible for Tier 1 activities supporting the Worldwide Centralized Engineering Infrastructure in the local CLOUD HOSTING center and remote support of other Cloud Hosting Centers     Tier 1 is the first-line support that handles medium complexity issues and activities such as systems deployment, support request resolution, and collaboration with other Emerson groups     Activities should be performed following existing documented processes and standards under our ISO 27002:2022 certification         In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:           System Administrator Windows and VMware.      Actively participate in daily operation and overall coordination of all activities related to the support of the Worldwide Centralized Engineering Infrastructure      Manage the virtual environments, including OS and virtual networking. Configure the virtual environments for individual projects on a day-to-day basis using templates and administration services. Ensure connectivity for the users. Ensure security and safety.      Actively participate in coordinating any setup activities with the local IT team      Contribute to maintaining equipment support, (re)certification of test and measurement equipment      Perform system installations for Emerson DeltaV software and hardware, powering-up and testing of these installations. Keep DeltaV firmware up to date according to project needs, knowledge base articles, and Emerson recommendations.      Conduct test activities related to system installation and power-up, configuring test applications, and performing DeltaV system hardware tests      Support the end users / front offices with connectivity issues, and with the internal testing and factory acceptance testing      Responsible for keeping all Emerson DeltaV equipment current for new releases and hotfixes. column2: 1. Configure Networks    TCP/IP inter-networking represents a heavy lift for many IT professionals because the concept is so    broad and deep. This complexity ramps up in Azure because you will never see the hardware behind    the Azure Networking Stack.    To succeed as an Azure Administrator, you need to understand required networking tasks like:    - Deploying and Configuring Virtual Networks.    - Orchestrating Routing Paths, especially in a Hybrid Cloud.    - Managing Public and Private IP addresses for your VMs and selected other Azure resources.      2. Monitor Resources And Log Analytics    You should learn how to use Log Analytics in the Azure portal to write Azure Monitor log queries.    Also, one needs to have a basic understanding of how to perform the below tasks:    - Use Log Analytics to write a simple query    - Understand the schema of your data    - Filter, sort, and group results    - Apply a time range    - Create charts    - Save and load queries    - Export and share queries      3. Compute    The Azure Administrator is most often identified with infrastructure-as-a-service (IaaS), which    normally boils down to running Virtual Machines (VMs) in the cloud. To that point, to be a successful    Azure Administrator, you should have familiarity with either or both of the Hypervisor platforms:    - Microsoft Hyper-V    - VMware vSphere    Some VM-related Administrative Tasks Include:    - Deploying VMs into Virtual Networks.    - Configuring VM for Optimum Cost, Performance, and Security.    - Backing up VMs and potentially providing Fail-over Recovery.    - Containers represent a newer way to virtualize services, and Docker is extremely wellrepresented in Azure. Therefore, one should understand how to deploy, manage, and monitor    containers.      4. Implement And Manage Storage          Azure provides Administrators with essentially limitless storage. You need space to store VM virtual    hard disks, Database Files, Application Data, and potentially useful data.      Furthermore, you should also study Powershell/CLI commands, which would help you to create/remove storage.
column11: Administration, Networking, Powershell, Schema, VMware Vsphere, Infrastructure, microsoft, VMS, Analytics, Monitoring

column2: Once roaming users logged into the remote VPN agent, Systems were in-sync with the domain thus latest password and domain policies were fetched on the users system automatically.          As we have provided the Cloud-based solution, there was consistent security, a unified policy to roaming users and blocked intranet access to non-compliant systems.          Due to Cloud-based solutions, the customer has the flexibility to increase the users license anytime without changing any hardware.          Benefits :            As the solution is Cloud-based there is no requirement for any hardware installation or maintenance          The solution provides all the NGFW features and capabilities like;          Application and user-based Security policy          Threat prevention includes Anti-virus, Anti-spyware, Vulnerability Protection, Anti-bot          It provides Sandboxing solution which will block zero-day threat (ATP)          It provides DNS security which blocks all malicious DNS request          It provides URL filtering which helps in blocking all unwanted websites          Once users are connected to Prisma access using the agent, all the traffic will be forwarded to the Prisma access cloud and get scanned for all the above security features.          Only the intranet traffic is been forwarded to physical DC via Prisma Access for accessing the internal application          All the internet traffic goes to internet directly from Prisma Access (No Backhauling of the traffic).          Conclusion :            After installation of the Prisma access solution and applying all the security features we saw lots of users trying to visit malicious websites and malicious DNS request which were getting blocked.          We also got the complete detailed report of the same which helped the customer to check on the end system and scan it.
column11: cloud security, Networking, WAN, VPN, Intranet, Cloud, DNS, Network security, Vulnerability, Roaming

column2: What are we looking for:         Hands-on experience in deploying and managing Kubernetes clusters in airgap environments, preferably within financial institutions or similarly regulated industries, is required.      Familiarity with a cloud-native CI/CD tool used for Kubernetes deployments is necessary.     Knowledge of GKE (Google Cloud Platform) and RKE (Rancher Kubernetes Engine) is preferred.     Knowledge of Rook-Ceph distributed storage is preferred.     You should be able to manage multi-region clusters for disaster recovery.     You should have experience working with programmable infrastructure, such as building a CI/CD pipeline.     Familiarity with monitoring and observability tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, and the ELK stack is expected.     You should possess good knowledge of Linux operating systems and be proficient in troubleshooting OS issues.     It is essential not to use terms like high availability or resilient systems without a thorough understanding of their basics, as building such systems in practice requires significant effort.     Knowledge of security and compliance frameworks and best practices relevant to financial institutions is necessary.     Preferred certifications include CKA (Certified Kubernetes Administrator) and CKAD (Certified Kubernetes Application Developer).         What you will be learning and doing         You will be working with customers trying to transform their applications and adopt cloud-native technologies. The technologies used will be Kubernetes, Prometheus, Service Mesh, and public cloud technologies or on-premise infrastructure.     The problems and solutions are continuously evolving in space but fundamentally you will be solving problems with the simplest and most scalable automation.     You will be hacking around open source projects, understand their capabilities, and limitations, and apply the right tool for the right job.     You will be educating the customers - from their operations engineers to developers on scalable ways to build and operate applications in modern cloud-native infrastructure
column11: Automation, Linux, Operating systems, Finance, Disaster recovery, Cloud, Infrastructure, Troubleshooting, Open source, Monitoring

column2: As a Service Engineer, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth operation and availability of our companys live production environment. You will be responsible for monitoring, maintaining, and optimizing the performance of our systems to deliver a reliable and uninterrupted experience to our customers. Your expertise and problem-solving skills will be vital in quickly identifying and resolving any issues that may arise, minimizing downtime and maximizing customer satisfaction.           ?       What you'll be doing           Monitor the live production environment to proactively identify potential issues or anomalies.         Respond promptly to system alerts, incidents, or outages, and take appropriate actions to resolve them.         Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, system administrators, and network engineers, to troubleshoot and resolve complex issues.         Be the central point of contact for incidents providing periodic updates to stakeholders.         Prepare and deliver incident reports to customers.         Develop and maintain automation scripts, tools, and monitoring dashboards to streamline operational tasks and improve efficiency.         Implement proactive monitoring and alerting mechanisms to ensure early detection of system issues.         Participate in an on-call rotation to provide 24/7 support for production systems.         Respond to and resolve critical incidents during on-call shifts in a timely manner.           Need to have           Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).         Proven experience working as a Live Site Engineer, Site Reliability Engineer, or in a similar role.         Strong knowledge of Linux/Unix systems, networking concepts, and web technologies.         Proficiency in scripting languages (eg, Python, Bash) for automation and tooling.         Experience with monitoring and alerting tools (eg, Nagios, Splunk, Datadog, Prometheus, Grafana).         Experience      Familiarity      with cloud platforms (eg, AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and containerization technologies (eg, Docker, Kubernetes).         Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think quickly and prioritize effectively in high-pressure situations.         Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.         Desire to grow in your technical skills beyond incident command.           Nice to have           Experience in fraud or bot mitigation domain         Experience using tools like FireHydrant           We value:         People - independent thinkers making data-driven decisions and taking project ownership     Teamwork - building trust, respect, and integrity to openly communicate and constructively challenge one another     Customer Focus - customer empathy and problem-solving obsession     Execution - actions with precision, professionalism, and urgency     Security - our lens for implementing processes, procedures, and programs

column2: Role & responsibilities: You will be responsible for the maintenance and support of cloud-based systems, including server infrastructure, virtual machines, and cloud-based applications.  This role requires extensive technical knowledge of cloud platforms and experience with troubleshooting and resolving technical issues.  You will work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to ensure the efficient operation of cloud infrastructure.This involves providing technical support and assistance for cloud-based applications and services.  The primary responsibilities include monitoring the health and performance of cloud-based systems, troubleshooting technical issues, and providing support to end users.  You will be responsible for managing and maintaining the day-to-day operation of a company's cloud-based infrastructure. You will be ensuring the reliability, scalability, and performance of cloud-based services and applications, and involves working with a team of IT professionals to troubleshoot and resolve any issues that may arise. You will also be responsible for resolving incidents and problems related to cloud services and coordinating with L1 and L3 support teams to ensure timely resolution.  . You will be required to work in 24x7 environment to ensure service availability to our customers cloud and IT infrastructure. Preferred candidate profile:   Should have a minimum of 3-5 years of experience in managing and maintaining AWS cloud infrastructure, specifically on AWS Network & Security.    The cloud SME should have strong technical skills and expertise in cloud computing and related technologies Experience on managing large scale environment running on Cloud (AWS)  Proficient in configuring and using monitoring tools like CloudWatch, Prometheus, Grafana, etc., and logging tools like CloudTrail, ELK, etc. You should be able to proactively monitor and analyze cloud infrastructure performance and troubleshoot issues. Experience with one or more infrastructure as code tools (Terraform, Ansible, CloudFormation, etc.) Experience to perform Patching using SSM, Tanium, Ansible Experience to configure Backup plans and assignment of resources. Ability to automate routine tasks and create scripts for AWS infrastructure management using tools like AWS CLI, AWS SDK, Lambda and AWS CloudFormation Experience with various database technologies like MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis, DynamoDB, etc. You should be able to design and manage scalable, secure, and highly available database solutions in the cloud. strong understanding of AWS security practices, including IAM, Security Groups, Network ACLs, KMS, S3 Bucket Policies, SSL/TLS Certificates, encryption technologies etc. You should be able to design and implement secure cloud solutions and ensure compliance with relevant security standards. Experience in managing windows server, Active Directory, GPO, etc. Familiarity with DevOps tools and methodologies like Git, Jenkins, Ansible, and Docker, and experience implementing Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines. Experience on supporting middleware  Experience working with some or all technologies below: EC2, ELB, ECS, RDS, Lambda, API Gateway, Route53 & S3, Glue Job, TGW, Lambda, Network, EKS, Container repository, Flow logs Windows Server, AD, GPO, Linux AD, LDAP, ADFS, TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, PKI, etc   Qualifications: BE/B.Tech/MCA/ B.Sc. (IT/Computer Science) AWS Certified Solutions Architect, AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, AWS Certified SysOps Administrator MCSA / MCSE / RHCE ITIL certification

column2: We are seeking an experienced Kubernetes EKS Administrator to join our team     As a Kubernetes EKS Administrator, you will be responsible for designing, deploying, and maintaining Kubernetes clusters within the Amazon EKS platform     Your expertise will ensure the reliability, scalability, and security of our containerized applications         Responsibilities:         Underlying Cluster Infrastructure:         Design, deploy, and manage Kubernetes clusters on Amazon EKS.     Configure and optimize worker nodes, networking, and storage.     Monitor cluster health and capacity.         Monitoring Kubernetes Metrics:         Set up monitoring tools (eg, Prometheus, Grafana) to track cluster performance.     Analyze metrics related to resource utilization, pod health, and scaling.         Service Management:         Create and manage Kubernetes services (LoadBalancer, NodePort, ClusterIP).     Ensure service discovery and load balancing for microservices.         Managing Pods & Deployments:         Deploy and manage pods using YAML manifests.     Handle rolling updates, scaling, and rollbacks.     Implement deployment strategies (eg, blue-green, canary).         Configuring Networking & Services:         Set up network policies, ingress controllers, and DNS resolution.     Integrate with AWS networking services (VPC, Route 53, ALB/NLB).         Troubleshooting Cluster Components:         Investigate and resolve issues related to pods, nodes, and networking.     Debug application failures and performance bottlenecks.         Managing Role-based Access Control (RBAC):         Define RBAC rules for users and service accounts.     Ensure secure access to cluster resources.         Using PersistentVolume & PersistentVolumeClaim:         Configure and manage persistent storage for stateful applications.     Set up storage classes, PVs, and PVCs.         Configuring ConfigMaps & Kubernetes Secrets:         Create and manage ConfigMaps for configuration data.     Securely manage secrets (eg, API keys, passwords) using Kubernetes Secrets.         Qualifications:           Experience   : 6-9 years of hands-on experience in Kubernetes administration, specifically within Amazon EKS.       Kubernetes Knowledge   : Proficiency in managing Kubernetes clusters, including pod deployment, networking, and troubleshooting.       AWS EKS   : Familiarity with Amazon EKS services, worker nodes, and integration with other AWS components.       Infrastructure as Code (IAC)   : Experience with tools like Terraform or CloudFormation for infrastructure automation.       Security Best Practices   : Awareness of Kubernetes security controls and RBAC.       Collaboration Skills   : Effective communication and teamwork.         Preferred Certifications:         Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA)      AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate
column11: Service management, Administration, Automation, DNS, network services, Management, Troubleshooting, Load balancing, AWS

column2: Job Summary This role is responsible for overseeing the design, implementation, and maintenance of robust and scalable software systems.  The role collaborates with cross-functional teams, including software developers, system administrators, and project managers, to create solutions that integrate seamlessly with existing infrastructure and deliver value to end-users.  The role ensures the efficiency, reliability, and performance of software systems. The role provides guidance to other team members on developing validation execution plans for new technologies. Responsibilities Oversees the installation, configuration, testing and maintenance of operating systems, application software, and system management tools. Monitors and tests application performance for potential bottlenecks, identifies possible solutions, and works with developers to implement those fixes. Optimizes software systems for performance, scalability, and resource efficiency to ensure optimal user experience. Gathers all the system engineering requirements for the infrastructure components by working with engineering groups and other stakeholders. Leads multiple project teams of other software systems engineers responsible for all stages of design and development for complex products and platforms, including solution design, analysis, coding, testing, and integration. Manages and expands relationships with internal and outsourced development partners on software systems design and development. Reviews and evaluates designs and project activities for compliance with systems design and development guidelines and standards; provides tangible feedback to improve product quality and mitigate failure risk. Provides domain-specific expertise and overall software systems leadership and perspective to cross-organization projects, programs, and activities. Drives innovation and integration of new technologies into projects and activities in the software systems design organization. Provides guidance and mentoring to less- experienced staff members. Education & Experience  Recommended Four-year or Graduate Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence. Typically has 7-10 years of work experience, preferably in systems engineering, computer programming language, or a related field. column2: About Aon Technology Aon Technology is responsible for supporting the delivery of global platforms in Aon to enable enhanced productivity and value delivery at a truly enterprise scale, partnering with teams across the organization to accelerate and drive the next wave of innovation on cloud. About the Role Aon is looking for an experienced Cloud Engineer. In this role you will work with engineering colleagues globally to help accelerate and drive the next wave of innovative new products and services on  AWS  and  Azure . You will be a member of a global Cloud Enablement team that helps define and support services, processes, and technology platforms that colleagues can leverage autonomously and securely.  You will also assist solution lines in their use of and transition to cloud-based deployments and patterns by providing expert advice and technical support. You will work with global teams to define and establish patterns, standards, and tooling to support greenfield cloud-native solutions and migration of existing applications from on-prem data centres. You are expected to have a strong self-directed work ethic with experience in provisioning, orchestrating, and supporting cloud-native services using automation and infrastructure as code.  Strong interpersonal and communication skills are required as this role will involve working closely with internal teams, external developers, partners, and customers and lead the evaluation/evolution of tools/technologies/programs with these groups. Responsibilities: Provide technical direction, engineering capability, guidance, and support across global development teams to help them adopt, build, and operate workloads in the cloud at scale. Work within a global virtual cloud enablement team and operations function,      partnering with other technology lines, solution line partners and stakeholders to understand and identify business demand, priorities,      issues, and strategies that will help establish and define the right platform to meet the short-term and long-term needs. Promote and enforce standard cloud-based methodologies, processes and tools that will ensure compliance with architectural and security standards which you will also contribute to.  Help build and support a DevSecOps culture within the organization by advocating developing and supporting best practices around automation,      monitoring, CI/CD, Infrastructure as Code, and secure coding amongst others. Act as custodian of the platform, guiding business & technology to make well-informed choices on projects which impact the direction of our technology estate. Drive ongoing infrastructure efficiency initiatives to ensure costs are tied to consumption. Lead by example and be a mentor to engineers across the organization and geographies on cloud-based patterns, designs, and engineering practices. Develop business case and assess financial impacts of proposed solutions and lead the technical team on RFP/RFI's. Required: 10+  years experience ideally providing technical engineering, consulting, and operational support with Cloud Technologies Detailed understanding of Azure and AWS and experience in building/migrating applications to these Cloud platforms. Working experience with Terraform, PowerShell and other Scripting/Automation languages and techniques. Experience with DevOps approaches and configuration, development, and automation toolsets for the cloud. Detailed understanding and experience with Cloud security controls and knowledge in security scanning tools like (Wiz). Highly Desirable Container/ Container Orchestration frameworks such as AKS, EKS, Container Apps, ECS      Fargate Experience working with CI/CD tooling and pipelines using tools such as Azure DevOps,      GitLab and GitHub. Native      Cloud infrastructure provisioning frameworks such as AWS      CloudFormation/SAM, Azure ARM/Blueprints Competencies Excellent written and oral communication skills with the ability to communicate clearly and concisely. Able to work independently and in a self-directed manner. Solution and Detail-orientated; Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Customer-focused; strong effective collaborator with ability to influence. Excellent technical skills with knowledge of cloud platforms, infrastructure,  networking and security best practices. Ability to multitask and prioritize activities to deliver desired outcomes. Education: Bachelor?? degree AWS/Azure/DevOps  certified Preferred Docker/Kubernetes certified Preferred.

column2: We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated individual to join our team as a LAMP platform and email services specialist. The ideal candidate will have solid experience in managing LAMP platforms, email services and related technologies. The successful candidate will be responsible for capacity planning, incident response and maintenance of our LAMP and email platforms. Key Responsibilities (Operational Role): Capacity planning: Conduct periodic capacity assessments of the LAMP and email platform. Collaborate with the team to plan and execute software upgrades and changes as required for future growth. Monitor and maintain server utilisation rates to ensure sufficient capacity for future growth. Incident response: Participate in the development and execution of incident response plans. Assist in the identification, response and resolution of technical and security incidents. Work to minimise the impact of security incidents and reduce user downtime Maintenance: Perform regular maintenance activities, including software updates, backups and security assessments. Ensure servers are up to date with the latest security patches to minimise the risk of security vulnerabilities. Technical responsibilities: Assist in the management and maintenance of various components of the LAMP stack and email services, including Debian, Apache, MySQL/MariaDB, and Postfix. Support network and firewall administration, monitoring and logging, cluster management, and load balancing Contribute to the management of cloud computing platforms such as OpenStack, virtualisation platforms such as Proxmox, and infrastructure automation using tools such as Salt and Terraform. utilization Requirements: Demonstrated experience in managing LAMP platforms, email services and related technologies. In-depth knowledge of various LAMP components and email services, including Debian, Apache, MySQL, Postfix and HAProxy. Familiarity with network security tools and practices, such as mod_security and fail2ban. Experience with monitoring and logging tools such as Nagios, Zabbix and auditd. Knowledge of cloud computing platforms such as OpenStack and virtualisation platforms such as Proxmox. Experience in infrastructure management automation using tools such as Salt and Terraform Proficient in programming and scripting languages, especially Bash, for task automation and simplification. Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills Excellent communication and collaboration skills We offer: Career plan and continuous training. Competitive salary commensurate with proven experience. + Variable incentives. Professional and relaxed environment. High performance teams.

column2: Are you a hands-on engineer with the expertise to solve difficult problems, having passion for cloud computing, strong interpersonal skills, and a desire to learn? Are you ready to dive deep into the latest cloud technologies? If the answer is yes, come and join us and create the future! Job description: The Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) team can provide you the opportunity to build and operate a suite of massive scale, integrated cloud services in a broadly distributed, multi-tenant cloud environment. OCI is committed to providing the best in cloud products that meet the needs of our customers who are tackling some of the worlds biggest challenges. Our Oracle Support organization is hiring a Senior Technical Support Engineer for our exciting, newly released product that allows customers to deploy Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) easily and quickly, right out of their Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) tenancies.??VDI technology allows all compute and storage to reside inside the corporate intranet, while only desktop pixels are shown to the client user through their local machine?? display. The security risk of the client machine is now greatly reduced because sensitive data doesn?? leave the virtual client machine inside the company?? data center.As a member of the Support organization, your focus is to deliver post-sales support and solutions to the Oracle customer base while serving as an advocate for customer needs. This involves resolving post-sales technical questions and issues regarding the use of and troubleshooting for our Electronic Support Services. A primary point of contact for customers, you are responsible for facilitating customer relationships with Support and providing advice and assistance to internal Oracle employees on diverse customer situations and escalated issues.?In this position, you will routinely act independently while researching and developing solutions to customer issues. Responsibilities: As a Senior Technical Support Engineer, you will be the technical interface to customers for the resolution of problems related to the use of Oracle Cloud Services, with focus on Oracle Secure Desktop (OSD) product.?? In this position you will facilitate resolution of post-sales technical customer Service Requests via electronic and phone means, as well as, technical questions regarding the use of and troubleshooting of Oracle Secure Desktop product. Essential functions (What you will do) This role will involve working ??ollow the sun??shift model and will include on-call or overtime during weekends and public holidays as needed.? ??????????Provide exceptional customer service, technical assistance to internal and external customers ??????????Apply troubleshooting techniques to provide unique solutions to our customers' needs ??????????Ability to understand customer heterogeneous environment . ??????????Resolve issues timely and accurately to help the team meet expected metrics and SLAs ??????????Maintain the highest level of confidentiality and security regarding our customers' accounts, assigned company equipment, and company systems ??????????Monitor release notes to obtain understanding of new or updated services ??????????Prepare evaluations of services or processes and recommend improvements ???????????Work with Oracle's Product Engineering groups if needed. ???????????Display and maintain high level of professionalism all times. ???????????Assist in ensuring Oracle Services meet Customer Satisfaction goals ??????????Create knowledge documentation as necessary to assist with possible future problem resolution ???????????Ensure proper implementation of Corporate programs and processes ???????????Be perceived by customers to be the highest level of technical support Oracle Services has to offer ??????????Prioritize workload and advance technical problems where appropriate to the next level of expertise Preferred Knowledge and Experience: ?????????Knowledge on Linux, Windows - Operating Systems ????????Knowledge and Experience on VDI Technology?and Identity Management ????????Networking (DNS, TCP/IP), IPsec and SSL VPN, Load Balancing, Routing Protocols, SSH, Network Monitoring / Troubleshooting tools?and authentication methods (2FA,RSA) basic understanding?. ????????Cloud services and understanding of Cloud platforms, technology and migration processes and tools.? ????????Deep expertise in one or more technical domains like OCI compute, storage, network, database, analytics, etc. ????????Ability to read, write and understand source code.? ????????Strong skills in HTML, JavaScript, Python and web technologies.? ????????Experience creating and using web-based services with RESTful APIs. ????????DevOps skills, such as Ansible, Kubernetes and terraforms.? ????????Positive attitude to a support role. ????????Skills on Azure is advantageous and Knowledge on Oracle Database Service for Azure. ????????Good understanding of Java errors especially exception stacks. ????????Good team player, Collaborator and communicator working in a global environment. ????????Self-motivated working style. ????????Skills in troubleshooting, and problem resolution. ????????Good customer interaction and organizational skills. ????????Excellent verbal and written English Language communication skills

column2: Job Summary This role is responsible for developing new software solutions and services using cloud software development techniques.  As a part of software cloud engineering team, the role designs, builds, and manages cloud systems and infrastructure including software, services, and solutions designed for flexibility, scalability, and resiliency to support current and future business needs in automated, repeatable way. Responsibilities Works with the software engineering team to identify and implement the most optimal cloud-based solutions for the organization. Plans, designs, and develops cloud-based applications. Manages cloud environments in accordance with the organization's security guidelines. Deploys and debugs cloud initiatives as needed in accordance with best practices throughout the software development lifecycle. Partners with DevOps to develop tooling and infrastructure for cloud development and cloud operations use cases, with a focus on microservices deployment and distributed systems monitoring and fault analysis. Executes job using Test Driven Development (TDD) approach, and supports continuous integration and continuous deployment patterns. Develops processes for enforcing cloud governance, architecture, operating procedures, monitoring, and system standards. Responds to incidents, owns them and drives to completion, participates in root cause analysis. Solves difficult and complex problems with a fresh perspective, demonstrating good judgment in selecting creative solutions and managing projects independently. Leads moderate to high complexity projects, delivering professionally written reports, and supports the realization of operational and strategic plans. Education & Experience  Recommended Four-year or Graduate Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence. Typically has 4-7 years of work experience, preferably in distributed & cloud computing, software & cloud design, programming languages, agile development methodologies, or a related field or an advanced degree with 3-5 years of work experience. Preferred Certifications AWS, Microsoft Azure, GCP, CSA certified Knowledge & Skills Software Engineering Agile Methodology Software Development Computer Science Java (Programming Language) JavaScript (Programming Language) Amazon Web Services Application Programming Interface (API) Python (Programming Language) Full Stack Development React.js DevOps Microsoft Azure Scalability SQL (Programming Language) Automation Kubernetes Angular (Web Framework) Microservices Docker (Software) Cross-Org Skills Effective Communication Results Orientation Learning Agility Digital Fluency Customer Centricity Impact & Scope Impacts multiple teams and may act as a team or project leader providing direction to team activities and facilitates information validation and team decision making process. Complexity Responds to moderately complex issues within established guidelines. Shift - No shift premium (India)

column2: Salesforce Expert (100% Remote!) Are you ready to harness your Salesforce expertise and revolutionize the business world, all while lounging in your favorite comfy spot? Lot Squared Development is in search of a Salesforce Business Analyst to join our team of innovators. If you're passionate about driving data-driven strategies and thrive in optimizing call center operations, this role is calling your name! About Lot Squared Development: At Lot Squared Development, we're not just in the business of building homes; we're crafting experiences and shaping communities in the heart of Washington, DC. From our strategic partnerships to our knack for uncovering hidden gems in the real estate market, we're making waves! And guess what? Our successes have been featured in The Washington Post, Urban Turf, Builder Online, and KBB Magazine. Position Overview: As our Salesforce Expert, you'll be at the forefront of innovation, leading the charge to ensure our call center's Salesforce CRM and the CTI dialer systems are running smoothly. Picture yourself as the guardian of data integrity, the architect of efficiency, and the driving force behind our continued success! Responsibilities:  Lead the charge as the expert in Salesforce and call center operations, using your insights to guide our business towards new heights.  Use your analytics prowess to uncover hidden opportunities in our KPIs and steer us towards data-driven victories.  Craft efficient business applications that set us apart from the competition, ensuring our sales systems are as sleek as they come.  Maintain our call center sales systems with precision, ensuring they remain strong in the face of any challenges.  Inspire our team with your leadership, equipping them with the knowledge and training needed to excel.  Keep track of our successes and present them to stakeholders like the superstar you are! Technical Requirements:  Minimum 5 years of experience in Salesforce, with a proven track record of success.  At least 3 years of experience crafting business applications for Salesforce, especially in call center operations.  Familiarity with predictive dialer software is a plus.  Strong grasp of computer programming languages and concepts.  Relevant certifications preferred: Salesforce Admin Certification or Consulting Cloud Certification. Soft Skills & Personality:  Master communicator, both written and spoken.  Lead with courage and diplomacy, guiding our team through any challenges that come our way.  A knack for solving problems and making informed decisions.  Attention to detail and organizational skills that keep us on track.  Possess the foresight to see the big picture and the wisdom to guide us towards success. How to Apply:  If you're ready to join our team and help us write the next chapter of our success story, hop on board by visiting our Careers Website: https://lotsquared.freshteam.com/jobs/eTNWoAaLk9fw/salesforce-admin-developer Lot Squared Development is an equal opportunity employer, welcoming applicants from all backgrounds to join our journey. Note: Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Ensure compliance with relevant industry standards and regulations. 8. Automate routine tasks and processes using scripts. 9. Develop and maintain infrastructure automation scripts and tools. 10 .Troubleshoot and resolve cloud infrastructure issues in a timely and efficient manner. 11. column1: Cloud Infrastructure Lead Engineer - AWS / Google Cloud Platform
column2: Job Description : - We are looking for an outstanding Cloud Infrastructure Lead Engineer, from a Product Company background, for a Series B $27M funded, Fintech Product company riding on the success journey of being a market leader in the segment and a growing employee strength of 1200+, located in Indiranagar, Bangalore. - Cloud Infrastructure Lead Engineer/Manager, will manage our cloud infrastructure running on various public cloud platforms. As a subject matter expert, you will provide oversight to our development and production deployments and manage access, security, and provide input on best practices. Key Responsibilities : - Build, configure, and manage cloud compute and data storage infrastructure for multiple instances of AWS and Google Cloud Platform. - Manage VPCs, security groups, and user access to our various public cloud systems and services. - Develop processes and procedures for using cloud-based infrastructures, including, access key rotation, disaster recovery, and building new services. - Help the business control costs by categorizing and tagging assets running in the cloud. - Develop scripts and workflows to manage cloud computing systems. - Technical lead on systems, networking, and capacity planning for new infrastructure projects for our engineering, technical support, and DevOps teams. - Manage our environments to be compliant with industry-standard regulations for security and reliability. - Provide oversight on log aggregation and application performance monitoring surrounding our production environments. Required Qualifications : - Hands-on experience running cloud infrastructure in public clouds like AWS and GCP. - Strong organization skills as you will manage costs and system access to AWS and GCP deployments. - Network expertise including routing, switching, IP addresses and subnets, firewalls, load balancers, VPN, etc. - Think about security along with ease of use and providing guidance to manage risk for the business. - Build documentation for cloud infrastructures. - Experience with deploying alerting and monitoring frameworks. - Ability to operate within a collaborative team framework. - Familiarity with cloud platforms AWS and GCP certifications required. - 6-10 years of experience in IT infrastructure design and management.

column2: 1.	Role Objective  The role will encompass a multifaceted set of responsibilities, primarily revolving around the deployment, configuration, hardening, testing, and Level 3 (L3) support of critical infrastructure components. These responsibilities are pivotal in maintaining the reliability, security, and optimal performance of the systems under the purview of this role 2.	Detailed Roles and Responsibilities:  Infrastructure Deployment and Management: ??Deploy and manage Linux-based infrastructure, including servers, virtual machines, and containers (AKS or Kubernetes) using scripts and tools (e.g., Terraform, ARM). ??Ensure the availability, scalability, and performance of Linux-based systems. Configuration Management: ??Develop and maintain automated configuration management scripts and tools (e.g., Ansible, PowerShell DSC) to streamline system provisioning and configuration. ??Implement best practices for system configuration and standardization.  Security Hardening: ??Conduct security hardening of Linux systems and containers to protect against vulnerabilities and security threats. ??Monitor and remediate security vulnerabilities promptly. Container Orchestration: ??Implement and manage container orchestration platforms like AKS and Kubernetes to support containerized applications. ??Ensure high availability, scalability, and reliability of containerized workloads. Testing and Quality Assurance: ??Develop and execute testing strategies for Linux-based systems and containers, including performance testing, integration testing, and security testing. ??Identify and resolve issues through thorough testing and validation. L3 Operations and Incident Response: ??Provide Level 3 support for Linux and container-related incidents and issues, including troubleshooting and resolution. ??Ensure timely response and adherence to Service Level Agreements (SLAs) for incident resolution, minimizing downtime and service disruptions. ??Conduct regular backups of critical data and systems, ensuring data integrity and availability in case of data loss or system failures. ??Implement and manage patch management processes to keep Linux systems and containers up to date with security patches and updates. Upgrade of Container based platforms like AKS and Kubernetes ??Participate in incident response and disaster recovery activities. Monitoring and Performance Optimization: ??Implement monitoring solutions (e.g., Azure Monitor, Prometheus, Grafana) to proactively identify performance bottlenecks and system issues. ??Optimize system performance and resource utilization. Documentation and Knowledge Sharing: ??Maintain comprehensive documentation for system configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting guides. ??Share knowledge and expertise with team members and stakeholders. Compliance and Best Practices: ??Ensure Linux systems and containers adhere to industry best practices and compliance standards (e.g., CIS benchmarks). ??Regularly audit and validate compliance. Capacity Planning: ??Monitor resource utilization trends and perform capacity planning to accommodate future growth. ??Recommend infrastructure enhancements as needed. Continuous Improvement: ??Stay updated on emerging technologies and best practices in Linux and containerization. ??Propose and implement improvements to enhance system efficiency, security, and reliability. Collaboration and Communication: ??Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, DevOps engineers, and system administrators, to support application deployment and operations. ??Communicate effectively with stakeholders to provide updates on system status and incident resolution. ??The candidate will also work with Architects on the Requirements and Design phases of solutions.  Assist in Technology Assessment and Selection: ??Collaborate in the assessment and selection of appropriate IT technology solutions to meet specified requirements. ??Evaluate proposals from equipment, software, and IT service providers to make informed decisions. Ensure Quality and Standards: ??Ensure the use of suitable performance and diagnostic tools for software testing and changes evaluation. ??Maintain and improve installation procedures and standards within the designated area of responsibility. ??Uphold quality standards for internal and client-oriented documentation. Technical Standards and Change Management: ??Develop technical standards and maintain a repository for deliverables, methodologies, and deployment documents. ??Lead change management efforts by preparing implementation plans, rollback plans, test plans, and conducting risk and impact analyses for critical or complex changes. AKS/Kubernetes Cluster Management: ??Create and manage deployments, pods, services, and namespaces within AKS/Kubernetes clusters. ??Implement auto-scaling and load balancing for applications as needed. ??Collaborate with DevOps teams to integrate AKS/Kubernetes deployments into CI/CD pipelines. Automation and Infrastructure as Code (IaC): ??Facilitate the deployment of applications to Kubernetes clusters through CI/CD workflows. ??Develop automation scripts using Kubernetes API and Azure CLI to streamline cluster management and deployment processes. ??Utilize Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform or ARM templates for efficient infrastructure provisioning. The Consultant ??AKS Administration will also contribute to the design (both High Level and Low Level) under the guidance of the Architecture team. KEY INTERACTIONS Internal:   	External:     ??Management ??Project Teams ??Architecture Team ??Engineering Team	??Developers ??Vendors and suppliers ??Customers BEHAVIORAL SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, AND EXPERIENCE (Special behavioral skills, knowledge and experience needed for the satisfactory performance of the job) 1.	Educational Qualifications:  ??Diploma or Degree in Computer Science or Engineering ??Accreditations: o	Linux certifications (Red Hat Certified Engineer) - mandatory o	CKA (Certified Kubernetes Administrator) ??advantageous o	Azure Fundamentals certification 2.	Skills & Experience: ??A minimum of 5 years of relevant IT experience, including a mandatory 3 years of hands-on experience in overseeing Cloud workloads, specifically with a focus on Red Hat (mandatory), and expertise in SLES (advantageous), AKS (mandatory), OpenShift (advantageous), and Containers. ??Experience of performance monitoring and capacity management, backup/restore operations, update management, hardening in Linux and AKS environments.  ??Experience in working in a senior technical support capacity (L3). ??Effective communication, facilitation and influencing skills - ability to present ideas clearly and concisely. ??Knowledge and experience implementing Linux server services with best practices. ??Experience in writing scripts in Bash (mandatory), Python and PowerShell ??Experience in IaC tools (Terraform - mandatory, ARM - advantageous) ??Experience in configuration management tools (Ansible ??mandatory, PowerShell DSC, Helm, Azure Policy) ??Strong analytical/troubleshooting skills ??IT Infrastructure deployment experience including troubleshooting, design, and implementation. ??Experience on transformation projects and successful transitions to implementation support teams. 3.	Behavioral Skills:  ??Strong communication skills ??Ability to work under pressure, independently and prioritize with minimal supervision. ??Multi-tasking skills and attention to detail ??Team player with ability to work with cross functional teams. ??Strong communication skills ??Critical thinking skills ??Attention to detail. ??Ability to juggle multiple, competing, frequently changing time-sensitive deadlines and priorities

column2: As an AWS Migration Leader, you will be responsible for leading and overseeing the migration of on-premises infrastructure and applications to the Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud platform. Leveraging your deep understanding of AWS services, best practices, and migration methodologies, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop migration strategies, design scalable architectures, and execute migration projects effectively. Your role will involve assessing existing environments, identifying migration opportunities, and implementing solutions that optimize performance, reliability, and cost-efficiency in the cloud. What You'll Be Doing: Assessment and Analysis: Conduct thorough assessments of on-premises infrastructure, workloads, and applications to evaluate their readiness for migration to AWS. Analyse dependencies, performance bottlenecks, and security requirements to develop migration plans tailored to specific business needs. Migration Strategy Development: Define comprehensive migration strategies aligned with business objectives, considering factors such as cost optimization, scalability, and regulatory compliance. Collaborate with stakeholders to establish migration priorities, timelines, and success criteria. Architecture Design: Architect scalable and resilient solutions on AWS that leverage native services and best practices, encompassing compute, storage, networking, security, and governance aspects. Design migration approaches, including lift-and-shift, re-platforming, re-factoring, and hybrid cloud models, to achieve desired outcomes. Implementation and Execution: Lead migration projects from planning to execution, coordinating activities across technical teams, vendors, and stakeholders. Provide technical guidance and oversight during migration activities, ensuring adherence to AWS best practices, security standards, and performance targets. Optimization and Cost Management: Identify opportunities to optimize resources, improve performance, and reduce costs through rightsizing, automation, and utilization of AWS cost management tools. Implement monitoring and governance mechanisms to track resource usage, enforce policies, and optimize cloud spend. Risk Management and Compliance: Identify and mitigate potential risks associated with migration activities, including data security, compliance, and operational disruptions. Ensure compliance with industry regulations, data protection laws, and AWS security best practices throughout the migration lifecycle. Knowledge Sharing and Training: Foster a culture of knowledge sharing and continuous learning by providing training, workshops, and documentation on AWS migration best practices and tools. Collaborate with internal teams to build migration competency and capabilities within the organization. What You'll Need: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science Engineering or related field; Master's degree preferred. Extensive experience (15+ years) in architecting, designing, and implementing AWS solutions, with a focus on migration projects. Strong proficiency in AWS services, including compute (e.g., EC2, Lambda), storage (e.g., S3, EBS), networking (e.g., VPC, Direct Connect), and databases (e.g., RDS, DynamoDB). In-depth knowledge of migration methodologies, such as lift-and-shift, re-platforming, and hybrid cloud architectures. Demonstrated expertise in designing scalable, secure, and cost-effective solutions on AWS, with a focus on performance optimization and operational excellence. Excellent communication, stakeholder management, and leadership skills, with the ability to influence decision-making and drive consensus among diverse teams. AWS certifications such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Professional, AWS Certified DevOps Engineer - Professional, or AWS Certified Advanced Networking - Specialty are highly desirable
column11: AWS, risk management, web services, network security, hybrid cloud, devops, networking

column2: EVERSANA  is the leading independent provider of global services to the life science industry. The companys integrated solutions are rooted in the patient experience and span all stages of the product lifecycle to deliver long-term, sustainable value for patients, prescribers, channel partners and payers. The company serves more than 500 organizations, including innovative start-ups and established pharmaceutical companies to advance life science services for a healthier world. To learn more about EVERSANA, visit eversana.com or connect through LinkedIn and Twitter. OUR   CULTURAL BELIEFS Patient   Minded:  I act with the patient?? best interest in mind. Client Delight:  I own every client experience and its impact on results. Take   Action:  I am empowered and empower others to act now. Grow   Talent:  I own my development and invest in the development of others. Win   Together:  I passionately connect with anyone, anywhere, anytime to achieve results. Communication   Matters:  I speak up to create transparent, thoughtful, and timely dialogue.  Own   It:  I hold myself and others accountable for results. Embrace Diversity   We create an environment of awareness and respect. THE POSITION: Reporting to the Manager ??Public Cloud Platform Engineering, the Cloud Engineer helps build and support platform services for Azure and AWS. This role includes communication with internal teams around updates and/or unexpected outages while working with public cloud vendors to help solve those issues. For each new service that will be supported, this role will focus on building automated solutions which can be passed to our Site Reliability Engineering team to build for specific business units. Key areas of impact this role provides are improving speed to market capabilities for through public cloud infrastructure, promoting development and operations best practices, innovative solutions, technical problem solving, and precision engineering through communications and proper blueprinting processes. The ideal candidate will foster a collaborative environment by leaning on a public cloud infrastructure background along with IaC experience. Areas of operation include Software, Systems, Network, Security, Cloud (Public/Private/Community/Hybrid), Automation, and Development and Infrastructure Operations. The candidate will primarily focus on engineering automated platform solutions. Engineers in this role will work tightly with DevOps Engineering and Enablement teams. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Our employees are tasked with delivering excellent business results through the efforts of their teams. These results are best achieved by: Participate in two-week sprints (planning, implementation, demo, retro)  Build cloud platform solutions based on business need which includes manual creation for understanding of the process, automation of the process, and hand off to internal development and operations team for implementation into the self-service portal.  Continuous learning and growth to stay current on new developments within Azure, AWS, and GCP. Demonstrate a commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion through continuous development, modeling inclusive behaviors, and proactively managing bias.  Accountable for working with engineering teams to help provide a minimum of 99.9% infrastructure uptime in accordance with current service level agreements.  Maintain and enforce ITIL standards and procedures around service strategy, design, transition, operations, and continuous improvement.  All other duties as assigned. The   above   list reflects   the   general   details   necessary   to describe   the expectations   of the   position   and   shall   not   be   construed   as   the   only   expectations   that may   be   assigned   for the position. An   individual   in   this   position   must   be   able to   successfully   perform the   expectations   listed   above. MINIMUM KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES: 3+ year(s) in working with public cloud infrastructure solutions (IaaS and PaaS solutions specifically).  3+ years working in technical software or infrastructure engineering teams.  Experience with Git based systems for source control management.  Experience in Azure & AWS. Experience in cloud security and best practices. Large-scale server and network management technology  Procedure and policy design, documentation, and dissemination  Understanding of global network design and inter-networking  Security engineering, server and network hardening, auditing, and reporting Strong technical, analytical, problem solving and verbal and written communication skills. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: Prior healthcare experience would be a plus.  Industry certifications based on Public Cloud Infrastructure (e.g., Azure MCSA/MCSE, AWS Solutions Architect) EDUCATION: Any computer graduates.
